title: Estimator
description:
**\\*This position is located in Winter Garden, Florida\\***


Tired of the high cost of living in an overcrowded city? Winter Garden, Florida, is a small city with a thriving economy. Its combination of a historical downtown, beautiful landscapes, and a reputation for being a safe community with low crime rates makes it an attractive place to live for both families and individuals. Winter Garden offers a desirable combination of climate, amenities, community, atmosphere, and economic opportunities, offering its residents an excellent quality of life. We offer an attractive relocation package, so join us in Winter Garden, Florida, and redefine your career and lifestyle where exciting opportunities await you!


For over 30 years, **Maddox Electric Co.** Inc. has worked on projects of many different sizes with the latest technology and highest industry standards. We are family-owned and operated, and we pride ourselves on our values. We are committed to hiring top-notch candidates to grow with us. We have grown to be one of the largest and most experienced electrical contractors in central Florida and believe that serving our community goes hand in hand with who we are as a company.


We are looking for the right fit to fill an opening for a Lead Estimator who will be responsible for: assigning work to estimating staff and overseeing the progress of estimates, reviewing details with the Estimator to help finalize for bidding, and ensuring procedures follow company standards.

**What we offer you:**

* 100% company paid health and dental insurance/90% company paid dependent coverage
* 401k with company match 25% of employee contributions max 6%
* Eligible for pension plan after 1 year of service with company contribution of 3%
* 6 paid holidays
* 3 weeks of PTO in 1 year or prorated depending on start date
* Various Aflac programs
* Employee recognition events
* Vehicle allowance or company vehicle and fuel card

**Pay Scale:** $79,000 - $85,000 per year depending on experience + performance incentive plan

**Job Duties:**

* Forward requests for quotations and update the bid schedule
* Ensure schedules are met
* Determine the most competitive bid approach with the Executive team
* Implement the project bidding and strategy plan effectively
* Review consistency with bid objectives
* Review estimates for completeness
* Analyze labor rates, indirect labor, and expenses for bid preparation
* Attend pre-bids, walk-throughs, and related meetings
* Establish a professional relationship with customers, engineers, and general contractors
* Assist in bidding to general contractors and develop communications with parties receiving quotes
* Develop a procedure and policy for maintaining bid files and records
* Oversee work of direct reports and provide regular communication
* Actively pursue and generate business opportunities
* Be willing to work necessary hours to complete job duties accurately

**Required Qualifications:**

* 2 years of experience in electrical project estimating and bidding
* Knowledge of Accubid, ConEst, or McCormick computer estimating systems
* Knowledge of methods and labor units for proper application and procedures
* Understanding of project general conditions, bidding requirements, bonding, and insurance
* Ability to read and understand all types of construction plans and specifications
* Working knowledge of trade terms, materials, methods, codes, contracts, and specification language
* Approach to estimating that is coordinated, consistent, thoughtful, accurate, and versatile enough to adapt to each type of project
* Ability to multitask in a fast-paced environment while maintaining effective reasoning and judgment
* Great verbal, written, communication, and people skills
* Ability to capitalize on opportunities

**Preferred Qualifications:**

* 5 years of experience in project estimating and bidding

title: Automotive Restyling Sales Specialist
description:
Sound Trax is highly recognized in the automotive restyling industry, with over 30 years of experience in the business and known for customer satisfaction. We are a family owned company, and offer a family atmosphere based on respect and integrity.

Sound Trax is looking to add another Sales Specialist to our staff who is familiar with the sale and installation of automotive accessories. This person must be able to utilize computers to work with our vendors and the internet to quote customer requested automotive accessory installations which can include, but are not limited to; stereos, navigation, back-up cameras, remote starters, alarms, tires, rims, hitches, bumpers, fender flares, bed liners, tonneau covers and other aftermarket add-ons. Sound Trax is seeking someone who is a self-motivated self-starter, who is energetic and willing to learn and grow with the business. This person is someone who takes initiative to get the job done, takes pride in their work, is reliable and does not need supervision.

**Responsibilities & Duties:**

* Strengthen existing customer relations & establish your own customer base.
* Effectively communicate with all levels of company personnel.
* Improve effectiveness by developing new approaches and techniques to maximize sales.
* Implement tools and strategies to sell products and services, as well as suggest and add innovative ideas to grow the company.
* Work independently and manage daily calendar.

**Qualifications/Requirements:**

* Energetic hard-working TEAM players willing to go the extra mile to succeed!
* Must be trustworthy, with great integrity and work ethic.
* At least 2 years + of automotive related retail sales experience preferred.
* Exceptional organizational skills to manage customer information and sales records.
* Communicate with customers to understand their needs and preferences.
* Follow up with customers after the sale to ensure satisfaction/establish customer rapport.
* Installation and car audio/accessories product knowledge; the more the better!
* Ability to multi-task while upholding quality and integrity of work.
* Maintain a clean and orderly work environment.
* Ability to perform in a fast-paced work environment.
* Multilingual abilities are a plus.

title: CDPAP, no HHA required, up to $21.09/hr
description:
**Take care of someone you know. Work near home. Your loved ones get care. You get paid.** 

GreatCare is helping **Medicaid+Medicare recipients above 21 years old** who need home care services to apply for **Consumer Directed Personal Assistance Program (CDPAP)** so that the caregivers can get paid while taking care of the family members, friends, relatives, neighbors, or literally anyone.

CDPAP allows patients to get help from someone they love and trust. CDPAP also allows caregivers to take care of their family members or friends **without any certification needed**, and without having to take hours off their regular work time and **get paid for the care they provide**.

**Eligibility to receive homecare through CDPAP:**

* Lives in New York State
* Qualified for Medicaid and Medicare (BOTH are required)
* Approved for long-term homecare services
* 21 years old and above
* Call at **646-799-6062 or 646-832-7647** to get evaluated now!!

**Document required for patient registration:**

* Patient's Medicaid copy
* Patient's address, phone number, and emergency contact's name and phone number
* Family doctor’s name and phone number

**Example of responsibilities for a CDPAP caregiver:**

* Provide health care services in patients residences
* Perform domestic and household tasks
* Transport and accompany patients to doctors office or to hospital
* Assist with patients personal care activities
* Monitor patients (vital signs, temperature, respiration, etc)
* Assist patients with mobility and physical therapies/exercises
* Provide companionship

**Who can be hired as CDPAP caregiver? Anyone but NOT:**

* Legal spouse
* Parent caring for a child under 21 years old

**Document required for caregiver registration:**

* Employment Authorization Documents
* Social Security Card
* Physical Form w/ Lab Reports: PPD/Quantiferon, Drug Screen, MMR
* 2 Reference Letters (friends or professional)
* Proof of Address (e.g.: utility bill)
* COVID Vaccines Record

**Referral Program**

If you refer a patient to us, contact coordinator for details of referral bonus.

**Contact Us to Apply**

**Tel: 646-799-6062 or 646-832-7647**

Website: www.greatcareny.com

Address: 110 West 34th Street, Suite 1207, New York NY 10001

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time

Pay: Up to $21.09 per hour

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Flexible schedule
* Flexible spending account
* Health insurance
* Referral program

Application Question(s):

* \\*\\*MUST ANSWER: Do you have someone that you can work as their caregiver? Neighbors, friends, relatives, parents, grandparents, etc. (Yes/No)
* \\*\\*MUST ANSWER: Does he or she have Medicaid and Medicare? (Yes/No)

title: EXECUTIVE LEGAL ASSISTANT
description:
Under the supervision of the Vice President and General Counsel, the candidate will be responsible for providing legal administrative and clerical support in the Corporate Legal Department.

The candidate must have good independent judgment and be able to plan, prioritize, and organize a diversified workload; have exceptional interpersonal and written and verbal communication skills; be highly organized, detail-oriented and efficiently manage time and projects with close attention to deadlines; be effective in stressful situations while maintaining a positive and professional attitude; be able to be proactive and anticipate needs; have flexibility as to working hours; be sensitive to and maintain confidentiality; and be able to effectively communicate with all departments within the company, outside counsel, customers, vendors, insurance carriers and key members of the executive team and senior management.

The successful candidate’s responsibilities will include the following:

· Experience handling multiple aspects of legal support including, monitoring, preparing, and filing regulatory/compliance annual reports; licensing, assembling miscellaneous support for discovery related to litigation matters and responding to Subpoenas, etc.

· Adaptable mindset with a positive attitude and willingness to pivot as needed to support business and legal teams

· Answering phones; taking detailed messages and/or properly rerouting calls

· Acting as a gatekeeper and collecting necessary information regarding all requests

· Coordinating with legal department personnel to ensure continuous coverage

· Opening and routing of mail

· Opening/closing/maintaining/and tracking legal department files

· Drafting and finalizing of correspondence for signatures by appropriate parties

· Creating, reviewing, and/or editing forms and other documents

· Conducting research via Internet, Westlaw (preferred but not required), etc.

· Manage calendar for attorneys including scheduling appointments, conferences, or meetings

· Arranging for conference rooms, food deliveries and other administrative tasks as needed

· Processing invoices for legal and other service provider fees and costs

· Performing general administrative tasks as assigned

**Qualifications and Skills**

At least 7 years of relevant experience working in an in-house counsel or law firm environment. A bachelor’s or associate degree from an accredited college is a plus.

Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite programs [Word, Outlook, Excel, Acrobat, PowerPoint]

Bilingual English/Spanish is a plus

Good Faith Estimate of Salary Range: $60,000 - $70,000

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $60,000.00 - $70,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Employee discount
* Health insurance
* Health savings account
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Work Location: In person

title: Training Records Specialist
description:
**LNK International, Inc.** is one of the nation's largest manufacturers of solid and liquid dose, over the counter (OTC) pharmaceuticals. For over 40 years, we have built a reputation for delivering the highest quality products, outstanding service and product innovation.


What sets LNK apart? We believe it is our employees. There is a commitment to quality in every department at LNK. As a member of our QA department you will be working with dedicated professionals who support and interact with all areas of the company.


Our full time employees enjoy competitive benefits including:

* 401(k) with generous employer match
* Health Insurance
* Dental Insurance
* Paid holidays
* Paid vacation


Shift: Day Shift

**Summary**


The Training Records Specialist is responsible for the accurate and timely recording of training completion records into the database in accordance with company standards and compliance with GMP documentation standards. This position requires the incumbent to be fully competent on all aspects of the software including reporting. Qualified candidates will be able to demonstrate the ability to learn software quickly, a strong technical focus and be fully engaged in learning all aspects of the software.


Responsibilities include but are not limited to:

* Monitors personnel training files, track course completion, and ensure that required forms are completed correctly and properly filed in a timely manner.
* Maintains a database of training modules and coordinates with affected area management to ensure that required training needs are met for all areas.
* Tracks training effectiveness and works with supervisors to ensure the success of the training program.
* Produce reports as required for management, auditors, etc.
* Support the change control approval process as needed.
* Maintain the annual FDA signature forms.
* All other duties as assigned.


Education and Experience Required

* At least 3 years experience maintaining a database or corporate training program.
* Strong computer skills and proficiency with word processing.
* 4 year degree or equivalent directly related work experience.
* Experience in a pharmaceutical company and proficiency with Trackwise preferred.

 *The salary listed is a good faith determination of potential base compensation that may be offered to a successful applicant for this position at the time of this job advertisement and may be modified in the future. When determining a team member's base salary and/or rate, several factors may be considered as permitted by law.*

  

LNK provides equal employment opportunities to all applicants and prohibits discrimination of any type on the basis of actual or perceived race, color, creed, religion, national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, age, sex or gender (including pregnancy, childbirth and pregnancy-related conditions), gender identity or expression (including transgender status), sexual orientation, marital status, military service and veteran status, physical or mental disability, genetic information or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state or local laws.

title: Courier
description:
**Company Description** *We are SGS – the world's leading testing, inspection and certification company. We are recognized as the global benchmark for sustainability, quality and integrity. Our 99,600 employees operate a network of 2,600 offices and laboratories, working together to enable a better, safer and more interconnected world.*

 **Job Description**  

Our **Dayton, NJ laboratory** is looking for a **Courier** to join their team! This position is responsible for the pickup and delivery of samples from SGS clients to SGS laboratory for testing.  

  

**Job Functions**

* Following a pre-defined route, pick up samples from clients for delivery to SGS labs.
* Establish and maintain good relations with SGS customers/clients by providing courteous, efficient and professional pick up service of samples, and delivery of sampling supplies in a safe and timely manner.
* Complete log sheet and obtain customer signature for chain of custody and billing purposes.
* Take the temperatures of the samples upon receipt
* Maintain company vehicle in good order and in a clean condition.
* Maintain a safe and satisfactory driving record.
* Complete SGS Defensive Driver training courses as required.

  

**Qualifications**  

* High school diploma/GED (Required)
* Valid drivers license (Required)
* Must be able to read, understand and follow work instructions in a safe, accurate and timely manner. (Required)
* Map reading, of formal maps. (Required)
* Candidates must be personable and able to establish good relationships with clients (Required)
* Ability to work well with others & independently. (Required)
* Flexible work hours may be required from time to time. (Required)
* Travel to other SGS locations or client location (Required)
* Ensures full compliance with the company’s Health & Safety, Code of Integrity, and Professional Conduct policies. (Required)
* Ability to lift/carry/push and/or pull upwards of 50 lbs on a frequent basis (Required)

  

**Additional Information**  

SGS is an Equal Opportunity Employer, and as such we recruit, hire, train, and promote persons in all job classifications without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, genetics, status as a protected veteran, or any other characteristics protected by law.


To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily with or without reasonable accommodations. The requirements listed above are representative of the knowledge, skills, and/or abilities required.


This job description should not be construed as an exhaustive statement of duties, responsibilities or requirements, but a general description of the job. Nothing contained herein restricts the company’s rights to assign or reassign duties and responsibilities to this job at any time.

You will receive a call back. Please note, this phone number is not for general employment information, but is only for individuals who are experiencing difficulty applying for a position due to a disability.

title: Associate Director of Commercial Advanced Analytics
description:
### **Job Description**

**For Current Kite Pharma Employees and Contractors:**
------------------------------------------------------


Please log onto your Internal Career Site to apply for this job.


We’re here for one reason and one reason only – to cure cancer. Every moment is dedicated to developing treatments and every action moves us one step closer to our goal. We’ve made incredible scientific breakthroughs and our pioneering personalized CAR T-cell therapies have changed the paradigm. But we're not finished yet.


Join Kite, as we make even bigger advances in cancer therapies, and help shape where our business and medical science goes next.


We believe every employee deserves a great leader. People Leaders are the cornerstone to the employee experience at Gilead and Kite. As a people leader now or in the future, you are the key driver in evolving our culture and creating an environment where every employee feels included, developed and empowered to fulfil their aspirations. Join Kite and help create more tomorrows.

**Job Description**
-------------------


We are seeking a highly motivated individual to join Kite’s Advanced Analytics & Data Science team, within the Global Analytics and Commercial Operations (GACO) organization, as the Associate Director of Commercial Advanced Analytics. The Associate Director will be accountable for developing and delivering data-driven insights to support new product launch strategy, planning, and implementation, with a primary focus on Multiple Myeloma. Internally known as an Associate Director of Marketing Sciences, the Incumbent will collaborate closely across key business partners including Marketing, Sales, Market Access, Integrated Insights, Pipeline Analytics, Finance, and Business Operations, as well as our external collaboration partner to develop deep analytical capabilities and proactively identify opportunities to enhance Commercial effectiveness. Reporting to the Senior Director of Global Advanced Analytics and Data Science, this individual will play a critical role in optimizing commercial launch readiness, facilitating strategic implementation, and maximizing the impact of our products in the market.




To develop and foster meaningful connections with stakeholders, we would prefer that this candidate be located at Kite’s Santa Monica, California headquarters (3 days per week onsite required) and would provide a generous relocation package as necessary. Based on the skills of the candidate, we may also consider having this position remotely-based within the contiguous United States.


**Key** **Responsibilities** **Include:**




* Lead the analysis and synthesis of complex information, opportunity identification, and development of actionable conclusions and recommendations.
* Conduct in-depth market analysis to identify trends, opportunities, and competitive dynamics, providing actionable insights to inform commercial strategies and tactics.
* Develop first-hand knowledge of Commercial data sets and support stakeholders as a trusted subject matter expert to navigate emerging business needs and the evolving data landscape.
* Conduct hypothesis-driven investigations into detailed physician-level, patient-level and transactional-level data, to gain business insights from various customer perspectives (HCPs, patients, payers).
* Analyze the effectiveness of marketing campaigns, promotional activities, and sales initiatives, and provide recommendations for optimizing marketing spend and resource allocation to optimize ROI.
* Develop sophisticated analytical techniques (statistics, predictive models, machine learning capabilities, and AI) to enable commercial organization.
* Lead the establishment of data and advanced analytics capabilities for multiple myeloma disease area.
* Collaborate closely with other insights and analytics colleagues to bring an integrated approach to actionable insights.
* Support launch decision making for Kite’s multiple myeloma asset including but not limited to developing analytics for field force sizing, physician segmentation, market tracking.
* Conduct ad-hoc advanced analytics to inform stakeholders on key business questions.
* Create, manage, and maintain expandable analytical models for recurring analyses.




**Basic Qualifications:**




Doctorate and 2+ years of experience


OR


Master’s degree and 8+ years of experience


OR


Bachelor’s degree and 10+ years of experience


OR


Associate degree and 12+ years of experience


OR


High School Diploma / GED degree and 14+ years of experience




**Preferred Qualifications:**




* Graduate degree in a quantitative field (Data Science, Engineering, Mathematics, etc.) or MBA with a bachelor’s degree in a quantitative field.
* 8+ years of experience with advanced data modeling and business intelligence techniques.
* 6+ years of pharmaceutical or life sciences experience.
* Prior experience in oncology, hematology, and/or rare disease commercial or market access advanced analytics/data science.
* Ability to influence and nurture projects end-to-end through collaboration and foster thoughtful relationships as this role necessitates a high degree of proactive engagement with cross-functional stakeholders including Marketing, Sales, Commercial Operations, and Market Access.
* Possess a deep working knowledge of advanced analytical resources and approaches, an excellent customer focus, and the ability to thrive in an agile environment.
* Excellent programming experience in Python, R, or a similar language (ability to independently develop, test, and implement data programs).
* Excellent understanding of database structures, data wrangling, cleansing, and manipulation.
* Ability to independently conduct various statistical tests like correlation, decision tree, regression, random forest to predict and assess customer behavior in the disease treatment journey (HCPs, patients, etc.).
* Significant experience conducting analysis with large healthcare data sets (claims, EMR, etc.).
* Creative, thoughtful problem solving skills and intellectual curiosity and passion for asking and answering questions in large datasets.
* Ability to influence a cross-functional and diverse team and can adapt efficiently and independently in an agile environment.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.

  



The salary range for this position is: $173,910.00 - $225,060.00. Kite considers a variety of factors when determining base compensation, including experience, qualifications, and geographic location. These considerations mean actual compensation will vary. This position may also be eligible for a discretionary annual bonus, discretionary stock-based long-term incentives (eligibility may vary based on role), paid time off, and a benefits package. Benefits include company-sponsored medical, dental, vision, and life insurance plans\\*.
For additional benefits information, visit:


https://www.gilead.com/careers/compensation-benefits-and-wellbeing

* Eligible employees may participate in benefit plans, subject to the terms and conditions of the applicable plans.

  

Kite is a biopharmaceutical company engaged in the development of innovative cancer immunotherapies with a goal of providing rapid, long-term durable response and eliminating the burden of chronic care. The company is focused on chimeric antigen receptor (CAR) and T cell receptor (TCR) engineered cell therapies designed to empower the immune system's ability to recognize and kill tumors. Kite is based in Santa Monica, CA. For more information on Kite, please visit www.kitepharma.com. Sign up to follow @KitePharma on Twitter at www.twitter.com/kitepharma.  



**For jobs in the United States:**
----------------------------------


As an equal opportunity employer, Gilead Sciences Inc. is committed to a diverse workforce. Employment decisions regarding recruitment and selection will be made without discrimination based on race, color, religion, national origin, gender, age, sexual orientation, physical or mental disability, genetic information or characteristic, gender identity and expression, veteran status, or other non-job related characteristics or other prohibited grounds specified in applicable federal, state and local laws. In order to ensure reasonable accommodation for individuals protected by Section 503 of the Rehabilitation Act of 1973, the Vietnam Era Veterans' Readjustment Act of 1974, and Title I of the Americans with Disabilities Act of 1990, applicants who require accommodation in the job application process may contact ApplicantAccommodations@gilead.com for assistance.

Our environment respects individual differences and recognizes each employee as an integral member of our company. Our workforce reflects these values and celebrates the individuals who make up our growing team.

title: Junior Technical Support Specialist
description:
**Title:** Junior Technical Support Specialist Grade 9 (OPEIU L153)

**Rate of Pay:** $75,933.15 (Weekly: $1,348.55 + $111.71 FICA Reimbursement)

**FLSA Status:** Non-Exempt

**Employer:** Joint Industry Board of the Electrical Industry

**Department**: Information Technology – Help Desk

**Location:** 107 West 33rd Street, Manhattan , New York

**SUMMARY:**

The Joint Industry Board of the Electrical Industry (JIB) was established in 1943 by the International Brotherhood of Electrical Workers, Local Union No. 3 and employers affiliated with the National Electrical Contractors Association. Its mission is to promote harmony between employees and employers, administer benefits for members and their families and improve competitiveness through progressive management, education, training, and technology.

**JOB DESCRIPTION**

ITD Helpdesk is seeking a Jr. Technical Support Specialist to provide technical support and customer service to our staff members at the Theory School location. Reporting to the Help Desk Manager, under general supervision, the Jr. Technical Support will be responsible for but not limited to:

* Responsible for all Network Infrastructure, office, and mobile automation under the supervision of IT management at Flushing.
* Provide technical assistance and support for incoming concerns and issues related to systems, software, and hardware.
* Configure and maintain appropriate software and functions according to specifications.
* Check computer hardware (HDD, mouse, keyboard, etc.) to ensure functionality.
* Phone setup and monitoring.
* Hardware/software installation, updates, configuration, troubleshooting, and issue resolution.
* Maintain daily performance of computer systems.
* Run diagnostic problems to resolve problems.
* Resolve technical problems with Local Area Networks (LAN), Wide Area Networks (WAN), and other systems.
* Assist with troubleshooting and upgrade of network and Wi-Fi.
* Provide onsite assistance to troubleshooting, configuration, and maintenance of mainframe, network, desktops, and Windows OS, working along with IT at Flushing.
* Monitor and Support Backup Software Systems.
* Responsible for tracking hardware/software inventory.
* Receive, setup and configure equipment and software.
* Proactively inspect equipment, repair anything not working and inform IT management of anything unable to repair.
* Keep IT management informed of all activities, requests from business and outstanding items.
* Assist in preparation for and conducting Disaster Recovery testing.
* Installation of Projectors, TVs, Speakers, Amplifiers, and Sound Masking
* Installation of Mounts and hardware on various wall types and ceiling types for Projectors, Displays, Speakers and Wireless Microphones
* Dress and route cable from IT closets to device locations (AV Equipment Rack, TV, Projector, Speakers)
* AV/Technical knowledge of current conference room technology.
* Manage content of broadcasts or presentations.
* Oversee microphone placement and conduct sound check.
* Testing of each individual piece of equipment ensures equipment is set to factory specifications to obtain optimum performance and report system problems immediately including solutions and/or recommendations.
* Review schedules for next-day requests to ensure equipment is operational.

**Work Environment and Physical Demands**

* IT work Help Desk Environment with physical demands prolonged periods sitting at a desk and working on a computer.
* Frequently to lift, carry, reach, push, pull, or otherwise move objects, including but not limited to all IT Help Desk Equipment.
* General office work involves sitting most of the time but may involve walking or standing for brief periods of time.
* In a 7-hour workday, must be able to lift /carry:
* 50 to 100+ pounds occasionally
* 25 to 50 pounds frequently
* 10 to 20 pounds regularly

**Position Type/Expected Hours of Work**

This is a full-time onsite 35 hours per week– Non-Exempt (OPEIU Local 153) position.

**Work Location**

**Theory School located on 107 West 33rd Street NY, NY 10001**

* Approximately ten (10) months out of the year will be in Manhattan beginning the week following Labor Day through the 3rd/4th week of June.
* Shift is Monday-Thursday, 1:00 PM – 9:00 PM, Friday 9:00 AM – 5:00 PM,

**JIBEI located on 158-11 Harry Van Arsdale Jr Ave Fresh Meadows, NY 11365**

* Approximately two (2) months out of the year will be in Fresh Meadows when classes are not in session beginning either the 3rd/4th week of June and ending Friday following Labor day.
* Shift is Monday through Friday, 9:00 AM – 5:00 PM at our Flushing location during summer break at the Theory School.

**Flexibility**: Must be able to work overtime when necessary.

**Travel** -- Occasional local travel may be required for this position.

**Required Experience, Skills, and Qualifications**

* Significant experience with Microsoft Windows and desktop products.
* Experience repairing and replacing desktop computers and component parts.
* Proven experience working with a Windows domain (adding/removing accounts and password resets).
* Experience using hard drive imaging software and web conferencing hardware and software.
* Prior customer service experience.
* Well-versed in using Google, Chrome, Firefox, and Edge in order to assist members working on their systems at home taking online courses.
* Must be a self-starter and possess the ability to work well with others in demanding and stressful situations with tight deadlines.
* Must be a quick learner, take initiative to research possible solutions, and communicate with IT management before taking any action that could possibly render equipment or services unusable.
* Ability to work with minimal supervision in a fast-paced environment and stay on task.
* Excellent communication skills (both written and oral) to support interactions with, visitors, guests, students, and other stakeholders as well as Management and Staff.
* Knowledge of inventory management is highly desirable, ability to order, stock and track all supplies and equipment utilized in the Center operations and communicate status report.
* Familiarity with the operation of personal computers is essential, particularly e-mail and Microsoft Windows based office programs. (Excel, Word, PowerPoint etc.).

**Desired Skills**

* Microsoft Certified Solutions Associate (MCSA).
* Microsoft Technology Associate (MTA).
* CompTIA A+ certified.

**HIPAA Compliance Required**

**Other Duties/Special Projects** 

Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities, and activities may change at any time with or without notice.

**BENEFITS**

* 10% of employer contribution to your 401K (before FICA gross-up reimbursement) *without* mandatory matching, vested immediately before.
* Basic Pay + FICA reimbursement (Social Security and Medicare Tax reimbursed as weekly added to compensation) = total weekly compensation.
* After completing 26 weeks of full-time employment from permanent hire date: Free health, dental, and optical insurance - funded by the employer, NO employee premium. Coverage thru Magna Care PPO (Medical), Express Script for Prescription, and DDS/Empire Dental. In addition, eligible employees may use JIB Medical P.C.
* Short Term Disability and Long-Term Disability.
* NYS Paid Family Leave.
* Jury Duty and Death in family bereavement days off.
* 11 Paid Holidays
* Paid Time Off
* Paid Vacation
* Retirement plan – Defined Pension Plan with vesting and age requirement, fully funded by employer.
* Life Insurance.

**Reasonable Accommodations Statement: To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. Reasonable Accommodations may be made to enable qualified individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.**

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $75,933.15 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Parental leave
* Professional development assistance
* Retirement plan
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* Day shift
* Monday to Friday

Application Question(s):

* Are you able to lift 10 to 50 pounds frequently

Experience:

* Windows: 2 years (Preferred)
* Customer service: 1 year (Preferred)
* Inventory management: 1 year (Preferred)

License/Certification:

* Microsoft Certified Solutions Associate (MCSA) (Preferred)
* CompTIA A+ (Preferred)

Ability to Commute:

* Fresh Meadows, NY 11365 (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: CDPAP, up to $21.09/hr, HHA Certificate NOT needed!
description:
**Take care of someone you know. Work near home. Your loved ones get care. You get paid.** 

GreatCare is helping **Medicaid+Medicare recipients above 21 years old** who need home care services to apply for **Consumer Directed Personal Assistance Program (CDPAP)** so that the caregivers can get paid while taking care of the family members, friends, relatives, neighbors, or literally anyone.

CDPAP allows patients to get help from someone they love and trust. CDPAP also allows caregivers to take care of their family members or friends **without any certification needed**, and without having to take hours off their regular work time and **get paid for the care they provide**.

**Eligibility to receive homecare through CDPAP:**

* Lives in New York State
* Qualified for Medicaid and Medicare (BOTH are required)
* Approved for long-term homecare services
* 21 years old and above
* Call at **646-799-6062 or 646-832-7647** to get evaluated now!!

**Document required for patient registration:**

* Patient's Medicaid copy
* Patient's address, phone number, and emergency contact's name and phone number
* Family doctor’s name and phone number

**Example of responsibilities for a CDPAP caregiver:**

* Provide health care services in patients residences
* Perform domestic and household tasks
* Transport and accompany patients to doctors office or to hospital
* Assist with patients personal care activities
* Monitor patients (vital signs, temperature, respiration, etc)
* Assist patients with mobility and physical therapies/exercises
* Provide companionship

**Who can be hired as CDPAP caregiver? Anyone but NOT:**

* Legal spouse
* Parent caring for a child under 21 years old

**Document required for caregiver registration:**

* Employment Authorization Documents
* Social Security Card
* Physical Form w/ Lab Reports: PPD/Quantiferon, Drug Screen, MMR
* 2 Reference Letters (friends or professional)
* Proof of Address (e.g.: utility bill)
* COVID Vaccines Record

**Referral Program**

If you refer a patient to us, contact coordinator for details of referral bonus.

**Contact Us to Apply**

**Tel: 646-799-6062 or 646-832-7647**

Website: www.greatcareny.com

Address: 110 West 34th Street, Suite 1207, New York NY 10001

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time

Pay: Up to $21.09 per hour

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Flexible schedule
* Flexible spending account
* Health insurance
* Referral program

Application Question(s):

* \\*\\*MUST ANSWER: Do you have someone that you can work as their caregiver? Neighbors, friends, relatives, parents, grandparents, etc. (Yes/No)
* \\*\\*MUST ANSWER: Does he or she have Medicaid and Medicare? (Yes/No)

Work Location: In person
company_addresses: 110 West 34th Street Rm 1207, New York NY 10001

title: Registered Dietitian for Assisted Living Communities - Contractor
description:
**Registered Dietitian - Contractor**

**Assisted Living Communities**

  

Do you enjoy working with residents in senior living communities? Then this consulting opportunity is a perfect fit for you. Join our supportive and amazing team!


We are looking for a positive and self-motivated consulting dietitian. As a Crandall Dietitian, you will have the opportunity to work with senior living communities to enhance the resident's food and nutrition experience. This involves auditing sanitation, meal service, staff development, and completing assessments on residents that have nutritional concerns. You will become a key member of the dietary team.


We are looking for dietitians to provide part-time services to Assisted Living Communities by providing quarterly audits (6-8 hours per community/quarter).  



  

**Perks and Benefits**

* Extensive dietitian training (online videos), plus a live Quick Start Training
* Excellent systems - Crandall has all the forms, policies, and documents you need for success
* National corporate support with Regional & Divisional Leaders across the nation
* Part-Time flexible work schedule (quarterly community visits)
* Quarterly conference calls providing a summary of updates on current standards
* Trainings providing Continuing Education Credits (CEU)
* Dietitian visits are Monday through Friday 8 am to 5 pm local time
* Depending on location multiple consulting opportunities may be available

 **Key Responsibilities:**

* Provide dietary services following state and federal laws and regulations
* Quality and regulatory assurance review/audits of Food/Nutrition Services, sanitation, food storage, preparation, and dining services according to national standards
* Clinical Charting (if required in states or corporations) weights, new admits, high-risk charting
* Nutrition education and in-service training for staff development and regulatory compliance
* Implementation of the plan of corrections

 **Preferred Qualifications:**

* Strong but friendly communication skills both written & verbal
* Someone who works well individually and in a team environment
* Knowledge of basic computer programs
* Ability to keep sensitive information/data confidential under HIPAA guidelines

 **Required**:

* Bachelors Degree in nutrition, dietetics, or related field
* Must be a Registered Dietitian with the Commission on Dietetic Registration (CDR) and provide annual verification
* State Dietary License if required by state
* Maintain current licensure as required by State law
* COVID-19 Vaccination or medical/religious exemption per state/corporation guidelines
* Current TB Test
* Must carry liability insurance as a contractor

 **We love referrals:** This job may not be for you, but perhaps you have a friend or colleague who would be a perfect fit, please share this opportunity with them.

 **Crandall Corporate Dietitians** is the nation's largest dietitian firm providing consulting and menu services to the senior living industry. Originally founded in 1966, Crandall was recently listed by the Phoenix Business Journal as the 33rd largest female-owned company in the Phoenix metro region.

title: Pharma Engineering Consultant
description:
**Why Precision for Medicine?**



Welcome to the forefront of innovation in cutting edge patient treatments. We are thrilled to present an incredible opportunity to join our high performing organization. As a leader within the life science industry, we are constantly pushing the boundaries of what is possible and redefining the standards of excellence. Our dynamic team is composed of vibrant professionals who are passionate about delivering high quality work for our partners and changing the lives of patients across the globe. If you are driven by innovation, thrive in a fast-paced environment, love to travel and are ready to make a real impact, then Precision for Medicine, Manufacturing Solutions wants you to join our team.


**Who Are We?**



We are Precision for Medicine, Manufacturing Solutions, the leading advanced therapy technical operations consulting company in the life science industry. As a **Patient Focused**, **People First** delivery team, we are committed to advancing manufacturing to achieve operational excellence and accelerate speed to market for next-generation medicines. Our manufacturing playbook has led to the creation of the largest and most mature advanced therapy manufacturing footprint in the world. We are an industry leader in providing project management, validation, engineering, quality/compliance, and consulting services to support our partners across the life science space in finding ground-breaking treatments and solutions. We believe that our culture of philanthropy, teamwork, training and development and commitment to the patient is the foundation to our teams' and partners' long-term success.


**Essential Job Functions (Include but are not limited to):**

* Lead, oversee, and execute client project initiatives, plans, or workstreams including ensuring team deliverables are completed in a timely and high-quality fashion.
* Coordinate with cross functional client departments providing hands-on support in navigating the engineering life cycle of cutting-edge equipment and manufacturing processes.
* Build internal and external understanding, buy-in, and commitment to decisions through mutual understanding, collaboration, and effective presentations skills.
* Develop technical documentation such as SOPs, requirements specifications, testing protocols, summary reports, etc.
* Mentor, coach and train internal PF Team Members on assigned duties, industry best practices, overall understanding of the business, and project driven technical skills.
* Provide continuous performance feedback and proactively manage Team Member performance.
* Develop team members with foresight to support project succession plans as identified by leadership.
* Contribute to and embody our Patient Focused and People First Mission ensuring philanthropic and professional development opportunities are available for their site.
* Support Manufacturing Solution's business development initiatives through:
	+ Building and maintaining professional networks.
	+ Proactively identifying and escalating client needs along with a proposed support plan.
	+ Identifying opportunities to expand presence and services for client support.

**Qualifications:**



Education and Experience Required:


* Bachelor's degree in Life Sciences, Engineering, or related discipline and/or comparable military experience.
* A minimum of 2-3 years of Project Engineer, Consulting, and/or relevant industry experience.


Other Required:


* Full Covid vaccination is required prior to the Team Member's start date with exceptions for medical and religious accommodations when reasonable.
* Full time on-site client presence
* Willingness to travel up to 100% or as required to support project and business needs.


**In return for your skills, knowledge, and passion, Project Farma offers a wide range of benefits including:**


* Competitive salary based on experience
* Aggressive bonus structure
* Medical, Dental, and Vision insurance effective your first day of employment
* 401k Plan with company match
* Paid Time Off and Company Paid Holidays
* Company Paid Maternity and Parental Leave
* Continuing Education Assistance

  

Any data provided as a part of this application will be stored in accordance with our Privacy Policy. For CA applicants, please also refer to our CA Privacy Notice.



Precision Medicine Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status or other characteristics protected by law. © 2020 Precision Medicine Group, LLC



If you are an individual with a disability and require a reasonable accommodation to complete any part of the application process or are limited in the ability or unable to access or use this online application process and need an alternative method for applying, you may contact Precision Medicine Group at QuestionForHR@precisionmedicinegrp.com.


It has come to our attention that some individuals or organizations are reaching out to job seekers and posing as potential employers presenting enticing employment offers. We want to emphasize that these offers are not associated with our company and may be fraudulent in nature. Please note that our organization will not extend a job offer without prior communication with our recruiting team, hiring managers and a formal interview process.

title: Payroll Specialist
description:
### **About NeuraFlash:**



We are a leading AI and Consulting Partner of Amazon & Salesforce obsessed with helping our customers transform their contact centers with AI Powered Experiences. Our expertise spans across the Amazon ecosystem with Amazon Connect, Lex & Contact Lens and Salesforce ecosystem with Service Cloud Voice, Einstein Bots and Digital Channels, Service Cloud, Field Service, CPQ, MuleSoft, and Einstein Analytics. We are experts in building experiences grounded in data that transform and optimize the employee and customer journey.


### **What sets NeuraFlash apart?**



Join NeuraFlash, where growth is not just a goal, but a way of life! Since our inception in 2016, we've been on a rocket ship, soaring to an average of 35%+ growth year over year. This rapid expansion has unlocked a world of exciting career opportunities for our team.



Imagine stepping into the heart of innovation, working with cutting-edge technologies like Salesforce, GenAI, and Amazon. Here, you won't just keep pace with the industry; you'll set it!



But growth isn't just about the company; it's about you. At NeuraFlash, we believe in endless learning. Our technical boot camps are your gateway to mastering new skills and technologies. Whether you're diving into GenAI or conquering Service Cloud Voice, we've got your back.



Our success is rooted in the satisfaction of our customers, and our exceptional CSAT score reflects that. Join our team, and you'll play a pivotal role in leading these impactful initiatives, contributing to meaningful change.



We are committed to nurturing positive working relationships, enabling us to harness the full potential of our team and drive success collectively. Through annual meet-ups in North America and India, as well as quarterly events online or in various regions, you'll build strong, cross-border relationships with teammates around the world.



Ready to become part of the NeuraFlash team? Let's redefine growth and innovation together!

### **AS A PAYROLL SPECIALIST, YOU WILL HAVE THE OPPORTUNITY TO:**


* Process the payroll for the US and Canadian-based employees
* Manage the state, local, and provinces payroll tax notifications
* Maintain the payroll records and employee salary databases
* Balance payroll accounts
* Work on other non-payroll related tasks, including assisting the Finance team with the monthly billing function

### **QUALIFICATIONS:**


* 3 to 5 years of experience in processing payroll; at a global level is a plus
* Experience with handling payroll tax notices
* Produce payroll reporting
* Some knowledge of accounting/bookkeeping is a plus
* Come into the office 2 days a week (Ramsey, NJ- Remote 3 days a week)

### **PREFERRED SKILLS:**


* Knowledge of the ADP WFN payroll system
* Knowledge of Quickbooks a plus
* Spanish speaking a plus

### **What's it like to be a part of NeuraFlash?**


* Remote & In-Person: Whether you work out of our HQ in Massachusetts, one of our regional hubs, our India office, or you're one of over half of our NeuraFlash Family who work remotely, we're focused on keeping everyone connected and unified as one team.
* Travel: Get ready to pack your bags and hit the road! For certain roles, travel is an exciting part of the job, with an anticipated travel commitment of up to 25%. So, if you have a passion for adventure and don't mind a little jet-setting, this opportunity could be your ticket to exploring new places while making a positive impact on clients.
* Flexibility: Do you have to take the dog to the vet, pick up the kids from school, or the in-laws from the airport? We know that a perfect 9-5 isn't possible. So you have to jump out to do any of those, no problem! We build a culture of trust and understanding. We value good work not the hours in which you get it done
* Collaboration: You have a voice here! If you work with a team of smart people like we do, it's a no-brainer to take suggestions and feedback on how to keep NeuraFlash thriving. Our executive team holds town halls & company meetings where they address any suggestions or questions asked, no matter how big or small.
* Celebrate Often: We take our work seriously, but we don't take ourselves too seriously. Whether it is an arm wrestling contest, costume party, or ugly holiday sweaters our teams love to have fun. And while we work hard, we don't forget to slow down and celebrate the big things and the small things together.


*Location: NeuraFlash strives to provide you with the flexibility to work in the location that makes the most sense for your lifestyle. For those that prefer an office setting, this role may be based in any of our hub locations within the United States, and India. If you prefer to work from your home, we can accommodate remote locations anywhere in the United States for our U.S. based employees, anywhere within British Columbia and Ontario for our Canadian employees, and anywhere within Colombia for our Colombian based employees!*

title: NYS Workers Compensation Group Self Insured Director
description:
**Title:** NYS Workers Compensation Group Self Insured Director

**Rate of Pay:** $288,052.67 (Weekly: $5,230.76 + $201.02 FICA Reimbursement)

**FLSA Status:** Full-time, Exempt

**Employer:** Joint Industry Board of the Electrical Industry

**Department:** Electrical Employers Self Insurance Safety Plan (EESISP)

**Location:** Flushing/Fresh Meadows, NY 11365

**Shift:** Full Time Onsite 35 Hours per Week - Monday – Friday 8:30-4:30, must be available for emergencies evenings and weekend via phone.

**SUMMARY:**

The Joint Industry Board of the Electrical Industry (JIB) was established in 1943 by the International Brotherhood of Electrical Workers, Local Union No. 3 and employers affiliated with the National Electrical Contractors Association. Its mission is to promote harmony between employees and employers, administer benefits for members and their families and improve competitiveness through progressive management, education, training, and technology.

The Electrical Employers Self Insurance Safety Plan (EESISP) is the largest and oldest group self-insured trust fund in New York State. For over 50 years, it has provided workers’ compensation and disability coverage to the members of Local Union No. 3, IBEW and affiliated employers. Since its inception, EESISP has paid over $1 billion in indemnity benefits and medical costs related to on the job injuries. In 1996, EESISP created a model Alternate Dispute Resolution and managed care program for workers’ compensation in New York.

**Work Environment**

This job operates in a professional office -- customer service environment. This role routinely uses standard office equipment such as desktop computers, phone, scanner, printer, keyboard, photocopiers, shredder, and fax.

**Physical Demands**

Sedentary work environment with physical demands described are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the functions of this job. This would require the ability to lift files, pull files/forms/books, stand, bending, shred documents, open/close filing cabinets as necessary.

**Travel** -- No travel is expected for this position.

**Required Experience, Skills, and Qualifications**

* Thorough working knowledge of NYS Workers Compensation Law & Disability Law
* Minimum of 15-20 years experience in the field
* Must have Insurance Industry managerial experience
* Experience managing a staff of 20 employees
* Experience in: Claims handling and supervision of claims examiners; Setting Reserves; Financial Management; Interacting with auditors, actuaries, accountants and attorneys; Setting goals and managing a team to accomplish those goals; Reporting to the Board of Directors
* Ability to interact with high level personnel at NYS WCB in Albany
* Familiarity with ADR programs and working in a Union environment helpful
* Other duties as assigned

**Other Duties/Special Projects** 

Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities, and activities may change at any time with or without notice.

**HIPAA Compliance Required**

**Reasonable Accommodations Statement:** To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. Reasonable Accommodations may be made to enable qualified individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

**Full-Time Benefits Package:**

* 10% of employer contribution to your 401K without mandatory matching, vested immediately before FICA gross reimbursement.
* Basic Pay + FICA reimbursement (Social Security and Medicare Tax reimbursed as weekly added to compensation) = total weekly compensation
* After completing 26 weeks of full-time employment from permanent hire date-Free health, dental, and optical insurance - funded by the employer, no employee premium coverage thru Magna Care PPO (Medical), Express Script for Prescription, DDS/Empire Dental, in addition eligible employee may use JIB Medical P.C.
* Short Term Disability and Long-Term Disability
* NYS Paid Family Leave
* Jury Duty and Death in family bereavement days off
* Paid Time Off
* Paid Vacation
* Retirement plan – Two Defined Pension Plan with vesting and age requirement, fully funded by employer.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $288,052.67 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Disability insurance
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Parental leave
* Professional development assistance
* Retirement plan
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* Day shift
* Monday to Friday

Experience:

* Workers' compensation law: 10 years (Required)
* Insurance Industry Managerial: 5 years (Preferred)
* Claims handling and setting reserves: 5 years (Preferred)
* supervision of claims examiners: 5 years (Preferred)
* Familiarity with ADR programs: 5 years (Preferred)

Ability to Commute:

* Flushing, NY 11375 (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Site Manager
description:
The Site Manager is responsible for managing, overseeing and ensuring the successful administrative, financial and operational aspects of a CityMD site. Essentially, a Site Manager is accountable for delivering a(n):

* Patient-centric urgent care experience from welcome to departure of the facility
* Inviting and hospitable environment where staff are engaged, developed and invested in the vision and mission of CityMD
* Exceptional experience where the patient will want to come back and refer their family and friends to CityMD

Essential Functions/Responsibilities

People Management

* Scheduling the front desk, scribes, medical assistants, and x-ray technician for the site (physician scheduling is not done by the managers) including operational, PTO, and Payroll hours; Assistant Site Manager will help in the scheduling process as needed
* Understanding at all times of how many patients have visited the site, whether there are any delays in the registration process, and what follow-up needs to be conducted after a patient is discharged
* Monitoring patient flow, managing ongoing daily front and back office operations closely (e.g., making sure that a registered patient gets assigned to the correct exam room and that the doctors know, during busy periods, which patient within their zone is to be seen next)
* Opening and closing the site

Site Management

* Supervising, managing, monitoring, coaching, developing and evaluating performance of all staff on an ongoing basis in accordance with applicable performance standards (with the exception of the doctors)
* Implementing, monitoring and taking corrective measures to ensure that the CityMD culture is being observed at all times, by all employees
* Conducting formal performance reviews of all staff (other than physicians)
* Collaborating with the HR team to formalize a development plan for staff as well as managing employee relations issues such as providing employees with formal write-ups and suggestions for improvement, and administering terminations as needed
* Holding departmental meetings and on-site training sessions as needed

Business and Patient Management

* Interacting with all major vendors, sales representatives, and other visitors to the site
* Meeting with patients to discuss any concerns regarding their visit
* Maintaining patient confidentiality in accordance to policy and procedure as well as HIPAA requirements
* Monitoring the site expense budget and keeping purchases/expenditures within guidelines
* Inspecting facility on a daily basis for any structural, cosmetic or operational repairs
* Following-up with corporate departments (e.g., IT, Payroll, Aftercare, etc.) for support and escalation of operational and/or patient issues
* Creating, analyzing and reporting on various business metrics such as, but not limited to: wait times, provider patients per hour, site NPS and survey comments, Yelp reviews, etc.

Qualifications

* 1-3 years of managing experience a must (urgent care, medical practice, hospital, retail, hospitality or restaurant industries)
* Bachelor’s Degree in Hospitality Management, Hotel/Restaurant Management, Business or other applicable degree preferred (will consider relevant management experience in lieu of degree)
* Happy and positive thinking, able to project this attitude around others
* Must exhibit passion for outstanding results and compassion for those we work with and serve
* Ability to successfully multitask
* Good computer skills (knowledge of a PC, Microsoft Office programs)
* Exceptional communication skills
* Great leadership qualities a must
* Able to handle group dynamics (help bringing unity to a diverse group)
* Comfortable with constructive confrontation and counseling management
* Has an entrepreneurial spirit and takes a proactive approach to business operations
* Bilingual language skills required or preferred based on site location.

Additional Information

This job will require long shifts, weekend, closing, opening shifts (will depend on schedule necessary at facility), and must work on-site.

Physical Requirements

The job may require, from time to time, lifting heavy objects on a regular basis, do repetitive tasks with few breaks, and require light cleaning. Heavy computer use required.

Direct Reports

The Site Manager will be responsible for directly managing the X-Ray Technologists, Medical Assistants, Shift Supervisors, Scribes and Assistant Manager(s).

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $70,000.00 - $75,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Flexible schedule
* Flexible spending account
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Shift:

* 10 hour shift
* 12 hour shift
* 8 hour shift

title: Regional Managing Director
description:
PayIt is a fast-growing GovTech company on a mission to modernize how residents interact and transact with government, improving the customer experience and helping our client agencies more efficiently and effectively achieve their missions. Our easy-to-implement platform consolidates government services and payments into one connected experience and enables our clients to drive resident trust, collect revenue quickly, and redeploy their staff to more important challenges. This innovative approach to government service delivery has garnered significant recognition in both the public and private sectors, including our inclusion in the GovTech 100 every year since 2017. PayIt solutions cover services including hunting and fishing licensing, DMV, courts, property tax, utilities, tolling, and more.



Our culture welcomes people who exhibit what we call **"PayIt DNA": High integrity, drive, grit, high aptitude, and team orientation.** We are collaborative and passionate about the work we do to improve the lives of our government clients and the end users they serve. We have ambitious scaling goals, and we look for team members who are ready to roll up their sleeves, solve problems, and find new opportunities to win with our clients. And we have a lot of fun together.

**About the Role:**



The Regional Managing Director will be responsible for developing and executing on growth of a defined region by securing net new customers at the State and Local government levels. The selected Sales Professional will be the "quarterback" of their region. You will be building, communicating, and driving support and alignment across resources internal and external to PayIt to execute on business. Those selling resources include their Solution Consultant (SC), Channel Partners (Technology and Systems Integrators), Marketing, Government Relations Firms, Client Success Managers, Product Managers, and Executives. Each sales professional will have an annual quota target with quarterly goals.


**What You'll Need to Have:**


* 5+ years of experience of meeting or exceeding a quota while selling SaaS-based solutions to the Public Sector.
* Relevant experience including but not limited to Quota Attainment, Territory Planning, Prospecting and Pipeline Building, Opportunity Execution, Competing, Negotiating and Closing, Strategic Account Planning with Client Success Managers, Networking and Marketing, Continued Learning and Development, and usage of the various technology tools required to perform job responsibilities.
* An extensive network in business and IT at major Midwestern public sector governments, technology and consulting partners, and local advisors or lobbyists.

**Why Work For Us:**


* Our mission matters. Your work will make life better for our government agency clients and the millions of residents they serve.
* You'll do some of the best work of your career here. We tackle complex challenges that are interesting to solve, and you'll grow a ton working at PayIt
* People are our most important resource. Everyone has a voice. Collaboration is our default setting. And we have fun together.
* We #payitforward with our corporate volunteer program, serving the communities where we work and live.
* Competitive salaries, excellent benefits, flexible working arrangements, and all the resources you will need to do your best work.


**What We Care About:**



We hire high aptitude, high integrity people who are great communicators and want to be part of a growing team.


**Commitment to Equal Opportunity**



PayIt is committed to diversity in its workforce and is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, creed, gender, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, sex, gender expression or identity, sexual orientation or any other basis protected by applicable law.



PayIt is also committed to providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities. If you need a reasonable accommodation because of a disability for any part of the employment process, please send an email to the People Operations Team and let us know the nature of your request and your contact information.


**NOTE:** **U.S. Citizens and all those authorized to work for any employer in the U.S. are encouraged to apply. We are unable to provide sponsorship in the United States at this time. PayIt participates in E-Verify. To learn more, click** **here****.** **Canadian Citizens and those authorized to work in Canada without sponsorship are also encouraged to apply.**

**To all recruitment agencies:** PayIt does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our careers' alias, PayIt employees or any other company location. PayIt is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.


**Stay Current on PayIt Happenings****: Follow Us On** **Twitter****,** **LinkedIn****,** **Facebook****,** **and** **Instagram****.**



Within the parameters of this position, ensure the confidentiality, integrity, and availability, and exercise due care of, company, client, and citizen data that is stored, processed, and transmitted by and for PayIt, as outlined in PayIt's Business Code of Conduct and Information Security Policies.

title: Workers Compensation Claims Associate
description:
**Job Title:** Claims Associate (Workers Compensation)

**Rate of Pay:** $67,780.57 ($1,203.76 weekly+ $99.71 weekly FICA reimbursement)

**Department:** EESISP

**Location:** On-site Fresh Meadows, NY

**SUMMARY:**

The Joint Industry Board of the Electrical Industry (JIB) was established in 1943 by the International Brotherhood of Electrical Workers, Local Union No. 3 and employers affiliated with the National Electrical Contractors Association. Its mission is to promote harmony between employees and employers, administer benefits for members and their families and improve competitiveness through progressive management, education, training, and technology.

**JOB DESCRIPTION**

Reporting to the Supervisor, under close supervision, the Claims Associate ‘B’ Grade 8 will perform various duties including but not limited to:

* Review of electrical industry workers' compensation claims and determine compensability.
* File all required workers compensation forms timely.
* Oversee medical management and investigations of claims.
* Calculate payroll and compensation payments based on set guidelines.
* Serve as liaison and interface with Magna Comp nurse and claimant as part of the review process.
* Assign cases for investigations and review progress.
* Prepare workers compensation claims for long-term disability.
* Ability to evaluate the degree of disability and scheduled loss value.
* Maintains a professional relationship with all appropriate parties involved with the claim.
* Refers cases as appropriate to management.
* Actively executes appropriate claims activities to ensure consistent delivery of quality claims service.
* Develops and manages claims through well-developed action plans; continues to work on the action plan to bring the claim to an appropriate and timely resolution.
* Analyzes and processes workers’ compensation claims by investigating and gathering information to determine the exposure on the claim.
* Communicate with Local 3 Business representatives regarding claims management.
* Perform other duties and special assignments as necessary.

**Work Environment**

We thrive to provide a supportive and collaborative environment. We are employee- focused emphasizing mutual respect a strong sense of community and a positive team culture. We offer a healthy work -life balances and a desirable work environment with a diverse workforce.

**Physical Demands**

Sedentary work environment with physical demands described are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the functions of this job. This would require the ability to lift files, pull files/forms/books, stand, bending, shred documents, open/close filing cabinets as necessary.

**Position Type/Expected Hours of Work**

This is a full-time onsite 35 hours per week– Non-Exempt (OPEIU Local 153) position. Days and hours of work are Monday through Friday 8:30AM-4:30 PM.

**Flexibility**: Must be able to work overtime when necessary.

**Travel**

No travel is expected for this position.

**Required Experience, Skills, and Qualifications**

* A four-year college degree required.
* A minimum of 3 years of experience as a workers’ compensation examiner required.
* Extensive knowledge of NYS Disability and Worker’s Compensation laws.
* Excellent interpersonal, organizational, and communication skills.
* Working knowledge of Microsoft Word & Excel.
* Must be able to work independently and collectively.
* Familiarity with claim reserve.
* Must possess the ability to make sound judgments.
* Strict confidentiality.

**Other Duties/Special Projects** 

Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities, and activities may change at any time with or without notice.

**Reasonable Accommodations Statement** To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. Reasonable Accommodations may be made to enable *qualified* individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

**HIPAA Compliance Required**

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $67,780.57 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Parental leave
* Professional development assistance
* Retirement plan
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* Day shift
* Monday to Friday
* No weekends

Application Question(s):

* Are you familiar with Claim Reserve?

Education:

* Bachelor's (Required)

Experience:

* Workers Compensation Examiner: 3 years (Required)
* NYS Disability: 3 years (Required)
* Workers' compensation law: 3 years (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: FCC CDD Analyst, Payments
description:
**Who We Are**



Cross River is a highly profitable, fast-growing financial technology company powering the future of financial services. Our comprehensive suite of innovative and scalable embedded payments, cards, and lending products deliver financial services for millions of businesses and consumers around the globe. Cross River is backed by leading investors and serves the world's most essential fintech and technology companies. Together with its partners, Cross River is reshaping global finance and financial inclusion.



We are on a mission to build the infrastructure that propels access, inclusion, and the democratization of financial services. While our company has tripled in size over the last three years, our strong sense of purpose led Cross River to be named to American Banker's list of Best Places to Work in Fintech for the last 6 years. The reason for this success is simple – our nimble and collaborative family culture lives in every member of our growing team. Together we are at the forefront of technology and innovation, and we invite passionate, collaborative, and motivated high performers to join our expanding team.


**What We're Looking For**



This position sits within the bank's Client Due Diligence (CDD team) and will be responsible for conducting client due diligence at a onboarding and ongoing basis, including reviewing fintech partner's BSA/AML and OFAC policies as well as its independent audit reports. The analyst will be working with various internal stakeholders, such as bank compliance, legal, operations, sales, implementations, to ensure that the partners we bring in are compliant with current regulations and aligned with the bank's own policies on an ongoing basis.



The Compliance team cares about the partner's onboarding experience, and we have fun doing it. If you like challenging problems, are analytical, and a great team player—we want to hear from you!


**Responsibilities:**


* Review Due Diligence memos and client documentation for new client onboarding, from an AML/KYC and Risk perspective.
* Conduct Ongoing Monitoring and Oversight over existing relationships, including shadow underwriting and/or sampling/QA based on CRB's risk-based approach.
* Ensure information is accurate, complete and in-line with existing CRB Policies and Procedures.
* Review and advise on high-risk features within the client structure, including (but not limited to) the client's proposed flow of funds, expected activity, regulatory structure and licensing requirements and general company background information.
* Review complex products and services arranged with clients within the Payments, Merchant Acquiring and/or Fintech spaces
* Communicate effectively with internal stakeholders, including Business Development, Partnership Management teams and other areas of the Control framework, including Risk, Compliance, BSA/AML and Operations.
* Provide guidance and advice on due diligence requirements from a risk-based approach.
* Assist the Business in implementation of Due Diligence process.


**Qualifications:**


* Knowledge of banking and payments products and services, including payments flows, virtual currency companies, MSB structures, NACHA and Card network structures, among others.
* Minimum 4-5 years of experience working within a due diligence or client onboarding framework within a Financial Institution, Payfac, MSB or general Payments industry.
* Background knowledge of AML, Compliance and Risk programs.
* Experience or familiarity with merchant acquiring and merchant underwriting.
* Ability to manage complexity, multi-task and deliver solutions on a tight deadline.
* Strong work-ethic with ability to deliver quickly with minimal manager direction, take ownership and work independently.
* Experience working within a strong regulatory/control environment.
* Strong communication skills, both written and oral.
* Willingness to build and shape a program from the ground-up.
* Overall positive disposition.
* Strong interpersonal relationship and partnership skills.
* Thoughtful approach and ability to create and validate new solutions.


**Preferred Skills:**


* Experience or familiarity with Fintech or startup culture
* Basic technology knowledge and prior experience working with third party technology providers (i.e., client onboarding/KYC vendors)
* BA/BS Degree or equivalent job experience

  



#LI-JG1 #LI-Hybrid



Salary Range: $65,000.00 - $90,000.00


Cross River is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Cross River does not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, non-disqualifying physical or mental disability, national origin, veteran status or any other basis covered by appropriate law. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit, and business need.


*By submitting your application, you give Cross River permission to email, call, or text you using the contact details provided. We will only contact you with job related information.*
