We are seeking compassionate and dedicated **Medication Aides/Technicians** to help our residents in the daily management of their medication. Working in our Resident Services Wellness Department, your assistance is key in helping residents take their medications safely, consistently and as directed by their physicians. This is a key area where our residents count on reliable support, and your attention to detail and disciplined approach will make a positive impact on their lives. Your role is essential to the care and safety of residents who choose to call The Bristal home. The attentive and loving care you bring to the medication services you provide are fundamental to the quality of life and the general wellbeing of our residents every day.


Full Time, Part Time, and Per Diem schedules available


Additional responsibilities include:

* Assisting residents manage Activities of Daily Living (ADLs) and the administration of their medications
* Following all policies and procedures, and adhering to the instructions of the Nurse Shift Supervisor and the Director of Wellness
* Ensuring the safety and wellbeing of all residents, while following company policies and procedures
* Following Medication Administration Records (MAR) and doctors' orders

**Qualifications:**

* Experience assisting those with Alzheimer's disease and dementia is a plus
* Maintain an abiding respect for the elderly and remain calm at all times
* Extremely reliable, dependent and observant
* Ability to work one weekend day per week
* Must have at least an HHA certificate

title: Waitstaff – Part-Time
description:
Looking for a career where you can make a difference in someone else's life? Where opportunities abound to advance your future, both personally and professionally? The Bristal Assisted Living is the place for you. You'll thrive in a premier senior care organization that values you as an individual — not just your experience and skillsets, but your unique talents and energy. You'll enrich the community in which you work, and that community will enrich you. We call what we do at The Bristal "hospitality with a higher purpose." We know you'll make an impactful difference. Because the difference is you. *Come join us!*


One of the strengths that sets The Bristal apart as a luxury assisted living community is our chef-prepared cuisine and the country club dining experience we provide three times a day. We are seeking friendly, professional and, above all, compassionate **Waitstaff** with the kind, patient and cheerful spirit to deliver on that exceptional experience. You know the satisfied feeling you get at an upscale restaurant when the servers do an excellent job? That's the same feeling we wish our residents to have every day, and as part of our Waitstaff team, your performance is key to making that happen. In this role you will be responsible for ensuring all meals are served and presented in accordance with the guidelines established by the Director of Food Service. The loving care, attention and great customer service you bring to the dining experience are fundamental to the quality of life and the general wellbeing of our residents every day.


Additional responsibilities include:

* Patiently and cheerfully taking resident meal orders
* Checking station tables for settings and cleanliness
* Reading the menu before service so that you can knowledgeably assist the residents with their selections
* Assisting in the plating and proper portion controls of some or all of the following: appetizers, salads, soups, beverages and desserts
* Bussing tables at the end of the meal


The ideal candidate will have the following skills/qualifications:

* Experience as a Waiter/Waitress in a restaurant or food-service-related industry
* Able to function in a fast-paced environment
* Have a strong ability to multi-task
* Possesses good communication, customer service and people skills
* Is professional, patient and able to satisfy a demanding customer base
* Experience working with a senior population is preferred, but not required
* Is a team player, willing to help out where needed to ensure a pleasurable dining experience
* Familiarity with food safety, food preparation and board of health guidelines is a plus
* Is able to adjust to different personality types and situations in positive ways
* Must always be reliable, caring and gentle in actions and demeanor
* Maintains an abiding respect for the elderly and remains calm at all times

description:

Because the difference is you. *Come join us!*


We are seeking a responsible and experienced **Kitchen Utility Worker/Dishwasher** to assist the busy kitchen team of a luxury assisted living community with various job-related tasks and other support activities as they arise. The position involves sweeping, mopping and the cleaning of equipment, such as mixers, slicers, peelers, fryers, blenders and counters. The right candidate will take great care and pride in their work and consider this entry position as a potential stepping stone toward building a career in food services.


Full Time, Part Time, and Per Diem schedules available


Additional job responsibilities include:

* Cleaning, prepping and washing dishware, silverware, glassware, pots and pans
* Ensuring all chemical dispensers are working and cleaning supplies are adequate, being careful to use all safety equipment to meet OSHA standards
* Sweeping and mopping floors as directed
* Emptying and cleaning garbage from kitchen to dumpster
* Assisting with heavy lifting
* Daily cleaning of steam kettle, grill, range tops, brazier, stainless steel surfaces, dish racks, dish storage areas, dishwasher and dishwashing area
* Monthly cleaning of all kitchen surfaces, including walls, ceilings, stairs, tables, table legs and appliances
* Assisting in the dining room, removing soiled dishes during meal service and returning them to the kitchen
* The ideal candidate will have experience in a busy kitchen or food preparation area and come with:
* Experience working in a restaurant, catering facility, hospital, hospitality, healthcare or similar food services related industry as a plus
* Must be able to operate in a fast-paced environment
* Must have physical ability for strenuous cleaning and lifting
* Ability to understand the English language and follow instructions with minimal supervision
* Proven ability to follow all rules, regulations, policies and sanitary standards established by management

title: Public Health Data Analyst
description:
**Company overview**:  

 With an annual budget of $2.3 billion and more than 7,000 employees throughout the five boroughs, the New York City Department of Health and Mental Hygiene (NYC DOHMH) is one of the largest public health agencies in the world, serving 8 million New Yorkers from diverse ethnic and cultural backgrounds. We're tackling a broad range of public health issues with innovative policies and programs and getting exceptional results, but our work is never finished. The breadth of our innovative programs provides the widest range of choices for every member of our team.  

  

With grant funds from the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC), DOHMH is undertaking a new initiative that will meet critical infrastructure needs and make possible strategic investments that will have lasting effects on public health. Investments and improvements through this initiative will help modernize DOHMH’s foundational capabilities and data infrastructure, enabling it to partner in complex health and health care environments and, in turn, support better public health outcomes, including COVID-19. This initiative supports larger efforts to rebalance investments in public health and more equitably serve communities and populations.  

  

The selected candidate will be an employee of Public Health Solutions, a nonprofit organization which is the fiscal and administrative manager of the grant but will work be supervised by DOHMH. This is a grant-funded position ending in November 2027.**Program description:**


The New York City Department of Health and Mental Hygiene (DOHMH)’s Office of Emergency Preparedness and Response (OEPR) was created to promote DOHMH’s and NYC’s ability to prevent, prepare for, respond to, and recover from health emergencies. OEPR is responsible for coordinating agency-wide emergency preparedness planning, exercises and training, evaluation of incident response and exercise performance as well as coordinating with community stakeholders and city, state, and federal partners on public health emergency planning and response.

**Summary of position:**


DOHMH has an opening for a Public Health Data Analyst. Reporting to the Director of Data & Analytics, this position is in the Bureau of Emergency Field Response (BEFO). The selected candidate will assist with ongoing analyses and the development of the technological infrastructure for future public health emergencies using lessons learned in the COVID-19 response.

**Duties:**


Key responsibilities include:

* Assist with and conducts research and analysis using a variety of quantitative methods across the Bureau including working with the Planning and Training, Operations, Logistics, and Exercises, and Medical Reserve Corps-Emergency Staffing Units.
* Collaborate with internal and external stakeholders to develop, document and maintain policies, procedures, systems, and applications to support citywide health emergency field operations
* Assist teams from across the Health Department and City on ways to best leverage, utilize, and even establish standards on the use and application of data, data formats, and data analytical tools across projects.
* Manage large datasets within SQL Server Database across multiple servers.
* Assist in the development of planning documents and targeted reports, dashboards, and data visualization models that surface key information about citywide health emergency field operations data.
* Assist with the conduct of trainings, including facilitating training modules and reviewing training curriculum.
* Participate in the development and implementation of exercises and drills.
* Serve as a key member of the NYC DOHMH Incident Command System (ICS) during emergency responses.

 **Qualifications:**

* A baccalaureate degree from an accredited college or university with a specialization in an appropriate field of physical, biological, environmental or social science or in public health.
* Previous experience working in one or more of the following areas: data analytics, emergency preparedness planning/management, public health, geographic information systems (GIS), or related specialized area for at least one year.
* Capacity and willingness to learn Microsoft SQL Server Management Studio, Esri/ArcGIS Online software, and data visualization software.
* The ideal candidate for this position must be a pro-active and self-motivated individual with the ability to work in teams and in a highly dynamic environment with multiple stakeholders and timelines.
* Salary - $72,000 -$72,000

 **Additional Desired Qualities:**

* Experience with data collection, analysis and visualization.
* Experience with writing and maintaining technical documentation, including procedure guides and data dictionaries.
* Excellent communication (verbal & written) and interpersonal skills.
* Strong analytical skills and ability to manage and report complex information.
* Experience working with the public health sector and coordinating projects involving multiple stakeholders.
* Ability to prioritize and work in fast-paced environment with hard deadlines.

 **Additional Information:**

* This is a temporary grant-funded position ending in November 2027.
* This individual must reside in the tri-state area (NY, NJ, CT) by their confirmed start date.
* Preference may be given to individuals residing in New York City (5 boroughs) or surrounding New York State counties.

req40607

title: Utility Service Representative III
description:
**Are we RIGHT for you?**


The word RIGHT stands for what we VALUE: Respect, Integrity, Growth, Honesty and Teamwork.


**Why join our team?**


Middlesex Water Company (NASDAQ:MSEX) has been an industry leader since 1897. We promote professional and personal development in a work environment that is supportive and responsive. We understand the importance of our services and the individuals who uphold our reputation.


Joining our team means that you have a multitude of benefits that support you in and out of the workplace such as- full medical, dental, and vision benefits, 401k, paid time off, tuition assistance, learning and development opportunities, employee assistance program, and more. To learn more, please visit www.middlesexwater.com


**Job Summary:**


The Utility Service Representative III performs meter service and installation and system maintenance/repairs under the supervision of Foremen, Sub-Foremen, Inventory Control Specialist, and Senior Mechanic as applicable. The successful candidate will be passionate about supporting and driving the Company’s Values, RIGHT: Respect, Integrity, Growth, Honesty and Teamwork.


**Work Performed:**


* Replace, install, troubleshoot, and repair meters and remote reading systems. Ability to field test meters/measuring elements. Remove meters/measuring elements for Shop testing.
* Perform all the maintenance and repair functions on the water distribution system including hand excavation, jackhammering, backfilling, paving, pipe cutting, and fitting; copper cutting, flaring, and fitting; valve repair, hydrant repair; valve box and curb box repair; snow shoveling and plowing under the supervision of the jobsite Foreman.
* Perform emergency and routine turn-off/on and inspects for illegal and cross connections.
* Safely operate all tools and equipment and promptly report all needed repairs.
* Maintain Company assigned vehicles in clean and safe condition and with an adequate inventory of parts at all times.
* Communicate with other employees, customers and the general public in a responsible and courteous manner.
* Assist with transportation service work including but not limited to fueling vehicles, picking up parts and securing the JRT Center.
* Assist with system repair work including but not limited to repairing/replacing/installing mains, services, hydrants and valves.
* Other tasks assigned by the Superintendents.


**Qualifications:**


* High school diploma or equivalent, required.
* Valid Driver’s license with the ability to obtain a Class B CDL within six months of employment, required.
* Availability to work overtime on an emergency (call-in) and/or scheduled basis.
* Available to work Monday through Friday and/or flexible hours.
* Willingness to work outdoors on a year round basis.
* Ability to keep accurate and organized records.
* Certification as a Competent Person in excavations or ability to obtain within six months of hire.
* Basic computer skills.


**Physical Requirements:**


* Ability to hand-dig and perform strenuous labor.
* Ability to lift 100 pounds assisted and 50 lbs. unassisted
* Ability to ascend and descend ladders.
* Ability to climb into and out of trenches.
* Ability to work outdoors in inclement weather.
* Willingness to work outdoors on a year round basis.
* Work emphasizes walking, standing for extended periods of time, visual acuity, hearing, and speech.


**Americans With Disabilities Act:**


* The work is typically performed while intermittently sitting, standing, walking, stooping, crouching, or bending.
* The employee frequently lifts light or heavy objects, uses tools and equipment requiring a high degree of dexterity, distinguishes between shades of color and utilizes the sense of smell.
* The work is typically performed while indoors or outdoors, sometimes in cold inclement weather. The employee is exposed to noise, dust, dirt, grease, hazardous chemicals, and machinery with moving parts.
* The work requires the use of protective devices such as masks, goggles, gloves, etc.


**Candidates must possess authorization to work in the United States.**


**Candidates must be able to pass a drug screen, pre-employment physical, background check, and have a valid driver’s license.**


**This position requires a Commercial Drivers License. Use of marijuana, whether allowed by state law or medical marijuana card, controlled substances, prescribed or otherwise, not allowed by the Federal Motor Carriers Administration of the United States Department of Transportation, disqualifies candidacy.**


**No phone calls please. We thank all applicants in advance for their interest; however, only those applicants who are being considered for the position, or are currently employed by Middlesex Water Company will be contacted.**


**Middlesex Water Company and its' subsidiaries are an Equal Opportunity Employer.**
company_description: Middlesex Water Company offers employee health benefits such as Medical, Dental, Vision, 401K, Tuition Reimbursement, and more!

title: Analytical Lab Technician-Piscataway, NJ.
description:
**Analytical Lab Technician**

**Piscataway, NJ, US**

**On-site**

  



Join the fun and assist Perfumers in the exciting daily operations of our Analytical Lab! Dive into the world of fragrances by extracting scents from various product bases to uncover their unique compositions. Get hands-on and run samples using cutting-edge gas chromatography (GC) and mass spectrometry (MS) equipment. Every day is an adventure in scent discovery!

  



At dsm-firmenich, being a force for good is not optional. Diversity, Equity & Inclusion is a shared responsibility woven into our daily work to not only benefit our People, Customers & Communities but also drive business value. Equal access to opportunities is a given, belonging is a shared feeling, authenticity is celebrated.

 **Your key responsibilities**


* Dive into the exciting world of extractions on various finished product bases!
* Prepare and present engaging informational output for Perfumery review.
* Get hands-on with operating, maintaining, and troubleshooting GC and MS equipment, all while following standard operating procedures.
* Take charge of managing the receipt and installation of gas tanks to ensure our machinery runs smoothly and efficiently. Record, label, and manage retains of all incoming materials and samples in the analytical lab.
* Keep our mass spectral library up-to-date with new materials from a variety of vendors, enhancing our capabilities.
* Maintain a neat and orderly workspace, and keep our lab stocked by reordering supplies as needed. Occasionally, lend a hand in the sample lab with flashpoint machines or other fun duties.

 **We bring**

* Endless opportunities for growth and advancement for those who embrace innovation and take initiative.
* Team up with gurus in health, nutrition, and beauty to drive groundbreaking progress.
* Partner with world-renowned brands to transform ideas into impactful solutions.
* Build a career that makes a significant impact on billions of lives, with the freedom to shape your own path.
* Dedication to creating brighter futures for customers, communities, people, and the planet.
* Thrive in a supportive setting where you're empowered to grow and contribute to meaningful change.

 **You bring**

* B.S. Degree in a scientific discipline is preferred, but equivalent analytical work experience in a lab environment is just as awesome!
* Embrace the importance of chemical handling safety and rock those safety regulations, guidelines, and procedures.
* Show off your skills with MS Word, Excel, Outlook, and Teams – you're a tech whiz!
* Be meticulous, organized, and detail-oriented – your precision will shine!
* Thrive in a fast-paced environment, handling a large workload with ease and enthusiasm.

  

dsm-firmenich is fully dedicated to inclusion because when people feel engaged and empowered, their creativity and innovation drives unprecedented progress. We aim to build a workplace where opportunity really is equal, so everyone can thrive. We do not discriminate: there’s a place for everyone at dsm-firmenich.

  

As a committed equal opportunity employer, we ensure our recruitment practices are inclusive and fair. We encourage the recruitment of a diverse workforce, representative of the communities in which we work, by using inclusive language, diverse interview panels, diversified sourcing strategies. Selection is based on qualifications, competency, experience, performance history and fit with the team to advance fair and equitable opportunity.

  

Employment decisions are based upon job-related reasons regardless of an applicant's race, color, ethnicity, national origin, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, disability, backgrounds, genetic information, protected veteran status, or any other status protected by law.

  

We are committed to providing reasonable support for disabled applicants in our recruiting process. Should you need assistance, and are comfortable to share this, please let us know.

  

As innovators in nutrition, health, and beauty, dsm-firmenich reinvents, manufactures, and combines vital nutrients, flavors, and fragrances for the world’s growing population to thrive. With our comprehensive range of solutions, with natural and renewable ingredients and renowned science and technology capabilities, we work to create what is essential for life, desirable for consumers, and more sustainable for the planet. dsm-firmenich is a Swiss-Dutch company, listed on the Euronext Amsterdam, with operations in almost 60 countries and revenues of more than €12 billion. With a diverse, worldwide team of nearly 30,000 employees, we bring progress to life™ every day, everywhere, for billions of people.

  

Please note this is a direct search led by dsm-firmenich. We only accept applications from candidates, not from agencies nor subject to agency’s fees, percentages or similar.

title: Executive Assistant #22
description:

St. John’s Episcopal Hospital is the only hospital providing emergency and ambulatory care to the densely populated, culturally and economically diverse, and medically underserved populations of the Rockaways and Five Towns in southern Queens County and southwestern Nassau County, New York. Celebrating over 110 years of community care, the 257-bed facility provides people of all faiths with comprehensive preventive, diagnostic treatment and rehabilitative services, regardless of ability to pay.


***Come Grow With Us!***

The Executive Administrative Assistant functions as a general facilitator of administrative details for the executive staff. This role supports two executives and must have the ability to work on his or her own accord and with little direction. The workload involves managerial, clerical and secretarial duties with frequent contact with the professional and administrative staff of the hospital.


**Duties include, but are not limited to:**


* Performs recording and support staff functions for the Chairmen of Service meeting,
* Responsible for setting up dates, arranging venues for meetings and notifying all members

title: Principal Program Manager, Business Change
description:
**About us**
------------

 **National Grid is hiring a Principal Program Manager, Business Change, New York Strategy & Transformation based in New York**


Every day we deliver safe and secure energy to homes, communities, and businesses. We are there when people need us the most. We connect people to the energy they need for the lives they live. The pace of change in society and our industry is accelerating and our expertise and track record puts us in an unparalleled position to shape the sustainable future of our industry.  

  

To be successful we must anticipate the needs of our customers, reducing the cost of energy delivery today and pioneering the flexible energy systems of tomorrow. This requires us to deliver on our promises and always look for new opportunities to grow, both ourselves and our business.

**Job Purpose**
---------------

  

National Grid is leading the clean energy transition, having announced its vision for a clean, fair and affordable energy future across its jurisdictions by 2050. To achieve this vision, we need to build a smarter, stronger, cleaner energy system. This means reimagining how we operate throughout the business and implementing new processes and technologies. The adoption of these changes is critical to our success. That’s where you come in.

  

Our success is largely dependent upon how well we:

* Engage, mobilize and prepare our people for the changes to come.
* Support leadership with building momentum and buy-in across their organizations.
* Connect the dots to drive commitment and urgency to what is a significant clean energy journey, often referred as a generational shift.

  



As Principal Program Manager for Business Change, reporting to the Strategy & Transformation office aligned to the New York Electric business, you will play a senior and critical role in preparing the organization for change. It will be essential to build deep connections into the NY business, being seen as a trusted advisor able to align and proactively respond and flex in support of business priorities.

  

Whilst key accountabilities listed below are similar to that of a Lead Program Manager – this position assumes the ability to work very much independently in a consulting capacity, to scope out opportunities for engagement, thinking strategically as to how to best partner, flexing as priorities and leadership asks shift and executing high quality output at pace.

**Key Accountabilities**
------------------------

  

* Work with senior stakeholders across the NY business to help them adapt to new ways of working and embrace transformational goals – focus and priority driven from NY leadership
* Deliver change of various sizes as a single change resource, pulling on resources across the business and through effective networks and stakeholder management
* Partner with internal and external experts to design, develop and implement targeted communications campaigns around central themes related to our transformation
* Consult, upskill, coach leadership across the enterprise as they develop and deliver their own change initiatives and lead their teams through change.
* Manage advocacy at the executive and stakeholder levels to develop buy-in for change
* Support the impacted businesses with information and detailed frameworks, where appropriate, to ensure that they can conduct the necessary activities to minimize organizational risks.
* Contribute to defining and maintaining the NG change methodology and standard templates.
* Partner with change practitioners across the organization to share best practices and lessons learned to develop a standardized change delivery approach.
**Qualifications**
------------------

  

* Bachelor’s Degree & 4+ years change management experience, preferably across both technology / process driven change as well as wider enterprise level change associated with behaviors, cultures, mindsets
* Project/Program Management and Change Management certifications highly desirable
* Track record of having deployed creative and innovative engagement solutions and being seen as an expert communicator but verbal and written
* High levels of business acumen and strategic thinking, able to spot, translate and develop emerging priorities into action with a solid performance driven background
* Self-Starter – heavily self-motivated and performance orientated and ability to not just make sense of but thrive in ambiguity
* Strong performance orientation and metrics driven mindset
* Sound knowledge of the NY Business, with ideally a deeper appreciation of the Electric business
* Strong facilitator likes presenting for small and large groups; in-person and virtual.
* Emotionally intelligent and self-aware -able to easily build rapport and flex style to suit different stakeholders.
* Excellent MS PowerPoint skills and ability to tell compelling stories through powerpoint.
* Ability to manage competing priorities and deliver on multiple projects in parallel.
* And importantly a strong team player – built on trust and respect - see’s the value of the sum of the team and can flex in and out to support …as well as have some fun (we are a great bunch!)
**More Information**
--------------------

  

Salary - $162,000 - $190,000


This position has a career path which provides for advancement opportunities within and across bands as you develop and evolve in the position; gaining experience, expertise and acquiring and applying technical skills. Candidates will be assessed and provided offers against the minimum qualifications of this role and their individual experience.

 **National Grid is an equal opportunity employer that values a broad diversity of talent, knowledge, experience and expertise. We foster a culture of inclusion that drives employee engagement to deliver superior performance to the communities we serve. National Grid is proud to be an affirmative action employer. We encourage minorities, women, individuals with disabilities and protected veterans to join the National Grid team.**
company_description: National Grid is one of the largest investor-owned energy companies in the US — serving more than 20 million people throughout New York and Massachusetts.

title: Communications Manager
description:
**Title:** Communications Manager


**Reports to:** Chief Development and Communications Officer


**Status:** Full-Time, Exempt


**Hours****/Location****:** Hybrid: Monday - Friday with occasional evening & weekend hours for events; Two Offices – 86th Street and 180th Street in Manhattan and community sites


**SUMMARY:** West Side Campaign Against Hunger (WSCAH)—established in 1979 and one of the largest and most successful food pantries in New York City—provides emergency food assistance and supportive services, including access to benefits like Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program (SNAP), to low-income New York families. West Side Campaign Against Hunger's mission is to alleviate hunger by ensuring all New Yorkers have access with dignity to a choice of healthy food and supportive services.


WSCAH has seen significant growth and changes through the COVID-19 pandemic, as food security has significantly increased, while our community of customers, partners, funders, and individual donors has also grown. WSCAH's aim is to increase the organizational profile across NYC through elevated communication and engagement, to highlight and position WSCAH as a leading change-maker in emergency food across NYC.


**Compensation and Benefits**: The salary range for this position is **$65,000 - $75,000** based on experience and qualifications. WSCAH offers a comprehensive benefits package, including company-paid medical, dental, and life insurance, 403b retirement plan with 6% match after one year of employment, as well as paid holidays and vacation leave.


**JOB DESCRIPTION:** West Side Campaign Against Hunger (WSCAH) is seeking a dynamic and versatile Communications Generalist to join our team. The ideal candidate will have a passion for our mission and be skilled in various aspects of communications, including marketing, public relations, social media, fundraising, event planning, website management, and overseeing the creation of materials. This role is crucial for enhancing WSCAH's visibility, engaging our community, and supporting our fundraising efforts.


**Responsibilities**:


* Work closely with the Chief Development and Communications Officer (CDCO) to create and execute WSCAH communication strategies to increase awareness of the organization and financial support for WSCAH.


* Lead and manage design, production, and distribution of fundraising and engagement campaigns across email, website, social media, and print.


* Support the creation of fundraising materials including appeals, customer stories, SWAG, and annual reports, as well as planning, overseeing, and implementing donor communications across all distribution channels.


* Collaborate with graphic designers, photographers, and other creatives as needed.


* Oversee the maintenance and updating of the WSCAH website to ensure it is current, accurate, and engaging.


* Monitor website analytics to track performance and identify opportunities for enhancement.


* Work with the CEO and CDCO to coordinate regular Board communications and support quarterly Board Meetings.


* Draft internal communications to staff and Board of Directors on organizational priorities, growth, and opportunities.


* Function as a collaborative and active member of External Affairs team including participation in events, cross-team and organizational initiatives.


**Required Skills and Qualifications:**


Qualified candidates will possess a passion for WSCAH's mission along with:


* Bachelor's degree and a minimum of 4 years of related experience


* Experience with website management and content creation


* Strong organizational skills and attention to detail


* Ability to manage multiple projects and deadlines simultaneously


* Understanding of current social media platforms and their use for non-personal engagement


* Excellent communication skills, including developing consistent messaging, compelling campaigns, and an overall cohesive communications platform


* Proficiency in Microsoft Office and strong familiarity with HTML email marketing, web-based marketing tools and social media platforms


**Preferred Skills and Qualifications:**


* Experience working in Emergency Food, or at direct service non-profit organization


* Understanding of regional philanthropic community


* Written and spoken proficiency in both English and Spanish


**The ideal candidate will also** demonstrate:


* A positive attitude, strong teamwork ethic and the ability to take complete ownership of responsibilities


* The ability to work under pressure and time constraints


* The ability to be strategic, creative, and flexible in the planning and execution of goals and strategies


* The ability to work well with people at all levels and to develop and maintain beneficial relationships with colleagues, donors, and community members


* Flexibility in schedule


This job description is intended to convey information essential to understanding the scope of the position. It is not intended to be an exhaustive list of skills, efforts, responsibilities or working conditions associated with the position.


WSCAH is committed to a diverse, equitable and inclusive workplace. WSCAH is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate based on race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status.


**COVID-19 Vaccination Requirement Notice**


Candidates for this position must have received or be willing to receive the COVID-19 vaccine by date of hire. All individuals hired for WSCAH positions that are on-site and/or require in-person interactions must be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 unless otherwise prohibited by law. WSCAH complies with federal, state, and local laws regarding accommodations related to this policy.

title: Geotechnical Field Technician
description:
Geo-Technology Associates, Inc. (GTA) is seeking a Geotechnical Engineering Field Technician to join our team. Candidates with an interest in building a career in the construction observation, environmental and/or geotechnical consulting fields are preferred. As a Technician, you will provide a wide range of construction oversight services for geotechnical and environmental focused projects. You will provide field support to geologists, engineers, and scientists for a diverse client base in the private, state and government sectors.


Some of the daily responsibilities for a Geotechnical Engineering Field Technician include:


* Perform field and on-site laboratory tests on soil, concrete, asphalt and other materials; Field testing involves moisture and density testing of soils, preparing sample specimens of soils, and nuclear density testing of compacted material


**CANDIDATE REQUIREMENTS:**

* Associate's or Bachelor's degree or high school diploma/GED
* Own reliable transportation, valid driver's license; and satisfactory driving record
* Ability to lift to 60 pounds regularly
* Ability to work both independently and as part of a team, self-motivated, possess a strong work ethic
* Enjoy Working Outdoors
* Must be authorized to work in the U.S.; visa sponsorship is not available
* NICET and/or ACI certifications - These are a plus, but not required
* Must have steel toe boots


This position may require standing for extended durations as well as repetitive motions such as lifting or hammering. The employee must have the ability to use their hands to handle, finger or feel; reach, climb or balance; crouch, stoop, crawl, kneel and sit, see and smell; including close, distance and peripheral vision, depth vision and ability to focus. The employee will regularly lift and/or move 60 pounds; and occasionally move 80 pounds or more (such as a loaded wheelbarrow of concrete or soil samples).


GTA will provide you with Personal Protective Equipment, which includes High Visibility Vest, Hard Hat, Gloves, and Safety Glasses.


**BENEFITS**

  

We offer a comprehensive benefits package which includes:


* Competitive Compensation and Annual Performance Reviews
* Expense Reimbursement
* 401(k) with company match
* Medical, Dental and Vision coverage options
* Company provided Life and Disability coverage
* Optional additional Life and Disability coverage
* Pre-tax Health Savings Account, Medical Flexible Spending Account and Dependent Care Spending Account options
* Paid Time Off & Paid Holidays
* Employee Referral Program
* Educational Assistance Program
* Training and Development Opportunities


**PLEASE NOTE: Any salary range listed for this position was assigned by Indeed,** ***NOT*** **Geo-Technology Associates, Inc. (GTA)****, and should not be considered accurate.**


We ensure nondiscrimination and equal employment opportunity in all programs and activities in accordance with Title VI of the Civil Rights Act of 1964, and all revisions and addendums thereof.

title: Office Assistant / Receptionist - 180th Street New York
description:
**Job Description**


**Title: Full-Time Office Assistant / Receptionist**


**Reports to:** **Director of People and Facilities**


**Status:** Full-Time, Non-Exempt (35 Hour Work Week)


**Hours:** Monday - Friday with occasional evening & weekend hours


**Location:** 549 West 180th Street, New York, NY


**About WSCAH**


West Side Campaign Against Hunger (WSCAH)—established in 1979 and one of the largest and most successful food pantries in New York City—provides emergency food assistance and supportive services, including access to benefits like Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program (SNAP), to low-income New York families. West Side Campaign Against Hunger's mission is to alleviate hunger by ensuring all New Yorkers have access with dignity to a choice of healthy food and supportive services.


WSCAH has seen significant growth and changes through the COVID-19 pandemic, as food security has significantly increased, while our community of customers, partners, funders, and individual donors has also grown. WSCAH's aim is to increase the organizational profile across NYC through elevated communication and engagement, to highlight and position WSCAH as a leading change-maker in emergency food across NYC.


**Compensation and Benefits**


The salary range for this position is $40,000 - $45,000 based on experience and qualifications. WSCAH offers a comprehensive benefits package, including company-paid medical, dental, and life insurance, 403b retirement plan with 6% match after one year of employment, as well as paid holidays and vacation leave.


**Position Overview**


West Side Campaign Against Hunger is seeking a highly motivated individual with a design mindset to fill our role of **Office Assistant / Receptionist** for our **warehouse facility located at 180th Street in Washington Heights**. The Receptionist will serve as the first point of contact for our organization, both in person and over the phone. The Receptionist's duties include offering administrative support across the organization, welcoming guests and greeting people who visit the location(s), and coordinating front-desk activities, including distributing correspondence and redirecting phone calls. This role requires an individual with excellent interpersonal skills, a professional demeanor, and a commitment to providing outstanding service.


**Key areas of responsibility will include:**


As the Receptionist, your positive attitude and excellent communication skills will enhance our organization's image and our visitors' experiences. Your role is pivotal in creating a welcoming and professional atmosphere for all guests and staff members. Key responsibilities include, but are not limited to:


**Visitor Reception:** Greet and welcome guests upon their arrival at the office, while providing a warm and welcoming environment. Direct them to the appropriate person or meeting room as necessary. Provide basic information to guests and the public about WSCAH's programs, services, and events. Assist in managing flow of visitors inside the warehouse facility.


**Communication Management**: Answer, screen, and forward incoming phone calls, ensuring professional and courteous communication. Receive, sort, and distribute daily mail and deliveries.  

  

**Administrative Support:** Provide basic administrative support as needed, such as scheduling, maintaining calendars, photocopying, faxing, filing, and purchasing and maintaining office supplies inventory. Organizing and maintaining electronic and paper filing systems. Assisting in the preparation and coordination of meetings, taking minutes as required.


**Office Coordination:** Maintain a tidy and organized reception, kitchen, and overall office area and coordinate with the facility's cleaning vendor. Ensure all visitors adhere to safety protocols and guidelines by following WSCAH policies and procedures. Assist in managing the flow of visitors inside the warehouse facility.


**Information Provision:** Provide accurate information in-person and via phone/email. This may include information about the organization, directions, or general inquiries.


**Preferred Qualifications**:


* High school diploma or equivalent required; associate's or bachelor's degree preferred
* At least 2 years of experience in a similar role
* Strong verbal and written communication skills
* Ability to multitask, prioritize, and manage time effectively
* High level of professionalism and strong customer service skills
* Experience with Microsoft Office Suite and Google Suite
* Bilingual (English/Spanish) preferred

  

The ideal candidate will also demonstrate:
* A positive attitude, strong teamwork ethic and the ability to take complete ownership of responsibilities
* The ability to work under pressure and time constraints as well as to handle several tasks simultaneously
* The ability to be strategic, creative, and flexible in the planning and execution of goals and strategies
* The ability to work well with people at all levels and to develop and maintain beneficial relationships with colleagues, donors, and community members
* Flexibility in schedule
  

  

*While the above experience and skills are preferred, applicants are encouraged to apply even if they don't currently meet all the listed qualifications.* This job description is intended to convey information essential to understanding the scope of the position. It is not intended to be an exhaustive list of skills, efforts, responsibilities or working conditions associated with the position.


WSCAH is committed to a diverse, equitable and inclusive workplace. WSCAH is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate based on race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status.

All individuals hired for WSCAH positions that are on-site and/or require in person interactions must be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 unless otherwise prohibited by law. WSCAH complies with federal, state, and local laws regarding accommodations related to this policy.

title: Casino Retention Coordinator
description:
#### **Description**

##### **Who We Are**


Bally's Corporation is a global casino-entertainment company with a growing omni-channel presence. It currently owns and manages 15 casinos across 10 states, a golf course in New York, a horse racetrack in Colorado, and has access to OSB licenses in 18 states. It also owns Bally's Interactive International, formerly Gamesys Group, a leading, global, online gaming operator, Bally Bet, a first-in-class sports betting platform, and Bally Casino, a growing iCasino platform.


With 10,600 employees, the Company's casino operations include approximately 15,300 slot machines, 580 table games and 3,800 hotel rooms. Upon completing the construction of a permanent casino facility in Chicago, IL, and a land-based casino near the Nittany Mall in State College, PA, Bally's will own and/or manage 16 casinos across 11 states. Bally’s also has rights to developable land in Las Vegas post the closure of the Tropicana. It shares trade on the New York Stock Exchange under the ticker symbol "BALY".

##### **Well, What About The Team?**


Bally's is looking for a Casino Retention Coordinator to help us run and coordinate the day to day on-site promotional activity and scheduling for Bally Casino US sites as part of the wider Player Engagement and Retention team and create market leading and engaging promotions to help drive customer engagement, focusing on increasing product and brand awareness.

##### **So, What Will You Be Doing?**

* Creating monthly promotional plans which are on brand, creative, and results driven
* Helping to maintain differentiated promotional strategies by brand
* Presenting promotional structures, plans, mechanics, and projected costs
* Briefing copy and creative into the Marketing Design and Development Team
* Liaising with CRM Leads on a regular basis to coordinate CRM and other marketing activity
* Catering marketing efforts to different audiences
* Working with Social Media executive to complement onsite/social promotional activity
* Building all promotional rule templates and follow legal and compliance approval processes
* Analyzing data and performance to optimize future promotional offerings
* Organizing all promotional mechanics and templates
* Anticipating audience and business needs by constantly evaluating the promotional market
* Developing new promotional templates and taking through from concept to delivery
* Performing related tasks and project work as required by the business

##### **And What Are We Looking For?**

* Have an understanding of the wider gaming industry including CRM
* Possess experience in creating and managing promotions
* Be a creative thinker with a good eye for detail
* Have ability to demonstrate experience in project and campaign planning
* Demonstrate campaign management / CRM system experience
* Display basic HTML knowledge
* Have experience working with task management tools (Excel, Monday.com, JIRA, Trello, Asana, etc.)
* Be organized and capable of working independently to set deadlines and show proactivity in their approach

##### **This Is What You'll Get**


Different benefits packages are tailored to fit each location, but here’s a taste of what may be on offer

* Annual leave
* Annual bonus
* 401K program
* Health insurance
* Company share scheme
* Home office allowance

##### **Dna / Values**


At Bally’s Interactive, we are driven by a set of core values that we like to call our DNA. We strive to embody our DNA and keep them at the heart of everything we do!


We are Always Ready to embrace change, adapt, and do what it takes to delight our customers. We believe that You Make the Difference, which is what gives our players the best experience and keeps them coming back. We are All One Team, looking out for each other, respecting diversity while connecting through a common purpose. Our teams are Learning Every Day by showing constant curiosity and the drive to learn from successes, mistakes, new experiences, and the people around us. At Bally’s we Love to Lead by thinking differently, seeking innovation, and always looking for ways to raise our game.

##### **Equal Opportunities**


At Bally’s Interactive, we are committed to promoting equal opportunities in employment and working conditions. Diversity, Equity and Inclusion are important to us, and we encourage a culture where everyone can be themselves at work. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success, this is our superpower. We do not discriminate against employees or job applicants on the basis of race, colour, nationality, ethnic or national origin, age, sex or sexual orientation, gender reassignment, religion or belief, marital or civil partner status, pregnancy or maternity, political opinion or disability.

##### **Flexible Working**


At Bally’s Interactive, we believe in the power of collaboration and working together in a shared space, as well as the benefits of working from home. We champion hybrid working wherever we can, offering a flexible blend of working in the office 3 days a week and from home twice a week.

##### **Salary Range $55,000 $70,000 Usd**


  
#### **Bally's Interactive - Jersey City**


#### **FIND YOUR CALLING ON THE BIG APPLE'S DOORSTEP...**


Our New Jersey office is situated right on the edge of the Hudson River with an unbeatable view of the New York City skyline, just a few blocks and a short ferry ride away from all the hustle and bustle of big city life. The weather gets a little brisk down by the water (so pack a good winter coat!), but there’s always something going on in this eclectic and lively city, voted the most culturally diverse US city in 2020.


Join our New Jersey team and you’ll find a fun bunch of people specialising in a wide range of areas across the business, including Payments, Fraud and Risk, Marketing, Chat, Social Media, and Customer Service. You will also find a burning passion for food, (honestly, there are so many great places to eat nearby), an unparalleled snack closet, and truly killer karaoke nights.

title: Dermatology Family Nurse Practitioner- Northern New Jersey
description:
**Job Title: Dermatology Nurse Practitioner**

**Location: Freehold, NJ**

**Company: Certified Dermatology**

**About Us:** Certified Dermatology is a premier, full-service dermatology practice with over 30 locations across New Jersey and Pennsylvania. We specialize in general dermatology and MOHS surgery, boasting a team of highly skilled and compassionate professionals. As an affiliate of Skin & Aesthetic Centers of America, we are part of a rapidly growing organization with plans for expansion over the next 1-3 years. We are dedicated to providing top-tier patient care and fostering a collaborative and respectful team culture.

**Position Overview:** Certified Dermatology is actively seeking a Dermatology experienced Family Nurse Practitioner to join our highly successful and growing practice in the Allentown region. We offer both full-time and part-time opportunities with a flexible schedule, allowing our providers to enjoy a satisfying work-life balance while pursuing their passion for dermatology.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Provide comprehensive dermatologic care, including general, surgical, and cosmetic dermatology.
* Diagnose and treat a wide range of dermatologic conditions.
* Collaborate with a dedicated team of healthcare professionals to deliver exceptional patient care.
* Participate in ongoing education and professional development to stay current with dermatologic advances.
* Contribute to a positive and supportive work environment, ensuring high patient satisfaction.

**Qualifications:**

* Excellent clinical skills and a commitment to providing high-quality patient care.
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills with the ability to work collaboratively within a team.
* Ability to manage a diverse patient panel, including general, surgical, and cosmetic dermatology cases.

**What We Offer:**

* Highly competitive compensation with a base salary for the first year, transitioning to production-based compensation as a percentage of collections thereafter.
* Comprehensive benefits package.
* CME allowance for ongoing professional development.
* Generous paid time off to support work-life balance.
* Flexible schedule with full-time and part-time opportunities available.
* Significant staff support in a collaborative team environment.

**Why Join Us:** At Certified Dermatology, you will be part of a thriving practice with ample opportunity for professional growth and advancement. Our practice values each team member and promotes a culture of respect and collaboration. With our upcoming expansion plans, there are exciting opportunities for career development and increased earning potential.

**To Apply:** Please submit your CV and a cover letter detailing your interest and qualifications for the position. We look forward to exploring how you can contribute to the continued success of Certified Dermatology.

**Certified Dermatology is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.**

**Summary:** Oversees and coordinates activities in a storeroom or stockroom.

* Supervise associates who issue or ship materials.
* Ensure that stocks and supplies are adequate, and are stored in a manner that preserves their quality.

* Resolve discrepancies between inventory and stock-control records.
* Assists vendors in gaining access to deliver (open gates, storerooms) and supervise while area is unsecure.
* Covers shifts for storeroom employees that are on vacation, sick, or otherwise absent.

**Job Summary**
---------------

  

**Summary:** Perform job duties required to maintain kitchen work areas, kitchen equipment in clean and orderly condition.
  

  

**Essential Duties and Responsibilities:**

* Sweeps and mops floors at appropriate intervals to ensure compliance with safety and sanitation standards.
* Operates large electric machines such as dishwashers, sanitizers, trash compactors, and glass crushers.
* Washes worktables, walls, refrigerators, and meat blocks and all other food prep surfaces as assigned.
* Segregates and removes trash and garbage and places it in designated containers. Steam cleans or hoses out garbage cans in appropriate and assigned areas.
* Washes dishes, pots, pans, utensils and other food preparation machines and equipment.
* Transfers supplies and equipment between storage and work areas observing all safe lifting standards.
* Assists with banquet table and front of the house set up as requested.
* Assist with loading or unloading and delivering supplies and product.
* Distributes supplies, utensils and portable equipment as needed.
* Complies with all outlined sanitation and safety requirements.
* Perform other duties as assigned.

title: Home Health Aide (HHA) *Recruiting for certified HHA who speaks Malayalam*
description:
*Always Compassionate Home Care is a licensed Home Health Care Agency which provides the highest quality of community home-based services, combined with exceptional compassion and innovation to enhance each patient’s quality of life.*

**Responsibilities:**  
- Provide direct patient care, including assisting with daily activities such as bathing, dressing, and grooming  
- Administer medications as prescribed by a healthcare professional  
- Monitor and record vital signs, such as blood pressure and temperature  
- Assist with mobility and transfers, using proper lifting techniques  
- Assist with tube feeding and other specialized medical procedures  
- Provide emotional support and companionship to patients  
- Follow care plans and communicate any changes in the patient's condition to the appropriate healthcare professionals  
- Maintain a clean and safe environment for the patient

**Qualifications:**  
- High school diploma or equivalent  
- Certification as a Home Health Aide (HHA) or Personal Care Assistant (PCA)  
- Knowledge of medical terminology and basic healthcare procedures  
- Experience working with patients in hospice care, memory care, or those with developmental disabilities is a plus  
- Ability to lift and move patients safely  
- Excellent communication and interpersonal skills  
- Compassionate and patient-focused approach to caregiving

*Always Compassionate Health provides equal opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, pregnancy, status as a parent, national origin, age, disability (physical or mental), family medical history or genetic information, political affiliation, military service, or any other non-merit based factors protected federal, state, or local law. All employment related decisions are based solely on relevant criteria including experience and suitability. If you require assistance to fill out this application form or during any phase of the job application process, please notify the person who gave you this form or Always Compassionate Health’s Human Resources Department and every reasonable effort will be made to accommodate your needs in a timely manner in accordance with federal, state, and/or local law.*

title: Research Support Associate
description:
**Position Details**
--------------------


Position Information
**Recruitment/Posting Title** Research Support Associate
  

**Job Category** Staff & Executive - Research Support (Laboratory/Non-Laboratory)
  

**Department** RSDM-Restorative Dentistry
  

**Overview**
The Biomaterials Research Lab (BRL) at Rutgers University is recognized as one of the most productive research laboratories in its field, boasting an impressive record of more than 50 scholarly publications in recent years. Dedicated to transforming oral health care, BRL is committed to making significant advancements not only within New Jersey but also on a national scale. This commitment is driven by a passion for innovation, excellence in education, groundbreaking discoveries, and a focus on patient and family-centered care. Moreover, BRL is deeply invested in addressing the health needs of our diverse community, ensuring that its research and developments are inclusive and beneficial for all. Equipped with the most powerful and cutting-edge tools available in dental research, such as the Scanning Electron Microscope, BRL stands at the forefront of technological advancement in the field. This state-of-the-art equipment allows the lab to conduct in-depth studies and develop innovative solutions to complex dental health challenges. At the heart of BRL’s success is a team of dedicated researchers and clinicians who share a vision for a healthier future. Through their relentless pursuit of excellence and their commitment to improving lives through dental health innovation, BRL continues to lead the way in biomaterials research.
  

**Posting Summary**
Rutgers School of Dental Medicine (RSDM) seeks a passionate and committed Research Support Associate for its Biomaterials Research Lab (BRL) in the Department of Restorative Dentistry, led by Dr. MA Saghiri, PhD. BRL is a leader in dental research, focusing on dentin structure, the impact of systemic diseases like diabetes on dentin quality, and the development of innovative, expandable biomaterials to restore dentin. The RSA will play a key role in research projects, from planning to execution, including data collection, analysis, and sharing results. This role also involves mentoring and teaching, contributing to the education of future dental professionals. Candidates should have a strong interest in dental science and biomaterials research, with a dedication to research excellence and education. This position offers a collaborative environment to contribute to advancing dental medicine and patient care.  

  

Among the key duties of this position are the following:
* **Research Design and Execution:**
	+ Collaborate with lab director and team members to design research protocols and experiments focused on understanding the structure of dentin, effects of systemic diseases on dentin quality, and the development of innovative biomaterials.
	+ Execute detailed experimental procedures with precision, maintaining high standards of scientific rigor and data integrity.
* **Data Analysis and Management:**
	+ Perform comprehensive data analysis using appropriate statistical and computational tools to interpret results from experiments.
	+ Maintain accurate and organized records of research data, ensuring accessibility for further analysis and review.
* **Grant and Manuscript Preparation:**
	+ Assist in drafting grant proposals, including developing research objectives, methodologies, and budgets to secure funding for future projects.
	+ Contribute to the writing and editing of manuscripts for publication in peer-reviewed journals, ensuring clarity, coherence, and compliance with journal guidelines.
* **Laboratory Operations and Compliance:**
	+ Support the maintenance of laboratory equipment and the ordering of supplies to ensure the smooth operation of research activities.
	+ Adhere to all safety and compliance protocols, including ethical guidelines for research involving human or animal subjects.
* **Collaboration and Communication:**
	+ Engage in collaborative research efforts within and outside the department, contributing to interdisciplinary projects and knowledge exchange.
	+ Communicate effectively with lab members, faculty, and external partners to facilitate progress on research objectives and dissemination of findings.
* **Professional Development** Stay updated on the latest research and developments in dental biomaterials and related fields through literature review, workshops, and conferences. Participate in training sessions and seminars to enhance technical skills and research methodologies.


* Performs other duties as assigned.

Qualifications
**Minimum Education and Experience**
* A Bachelor’s Degree in a relevant science with at least three years of related research experience (which may include relevant research performed as part of college coursework).
* Relevant Sciences include Neuroscience, Psychological/Cognitive Science, Social Work and Biological Science.
* Experience with data analysis, data management or computer coding may also be counted as related research experience.


  

**Certifications/Licenses**
  

**Required Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities**
* Strong analytical skills, with experience in data analysis, data management, and potentially computer coding, as applicable to research in dental biomaterials or related scientific inquiries.
* Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, necessary for effective collaboration across multiple departments and interactions with research participants, including those who may have neuropsychiatric problems.
* The ability to work empathetically and professionally with a diverse range of participants is essential.
* Demonstrated ability to work independently and as part of a team, with a strong commitment to contributing to interdisciplinary research efforts.
* Flexibility and adaptability to meet the changing needs and priorities of research projects and the lab environment.
* A commitment to ethical research practices and a thorough understanding of compliance and safety protocols relevant to the field.


  

**Preferred Qualifications**
* A Master’s degree or a Doctor of Dental Surgery (DDS) degree from an accredited institution in a relevant field of study. Relevant fields include, but are not limited to, Dental Sciences, Biomaterials, Dental materials, Computer Engineering, Material Science.
* A minimum of 3 years of related research experience post-graduation. This experience should demonstrate a solid foundation in experimental design, data collection, and analysis within the context of dental sciences or closely related fields.
* Experience in managing and conducting research projects, including familiarity with laboratory procedures, data analysis software, and research methodologies pertinent to the field of dental biomaterials or similar areas.
* A track record of contributing to the scientific community, evidenced by at least 3 publications in peer-reviewed journals. These publications should ideally be related to dental science, biomaterials research, or other relevant fields, showcasing the candidate’s ability to conduct meaningful research and disseminate findings effectively.
